2387 assert_equal(a.copy().argsort(kind=kind), r, msg)
2388 assert_equal(b.copy().argsort(kind=kind), rr, msg)
2389
2390 # test unicode argsorts.
2391 s = 'aaaaaaaa'
2392 a = np.array([s + chr(i) for i in range(101)], dtype=np.str_)
2393 b = a[::-1]
2394 r = np.arange(101)
2395 rr = r[::-1]
2396 for kind in self.sort_kinds:
2397 msg = "unicode argsort, kind=%s" % kind
2398 assert_equal(a.copy().argsort(kind=kind), r, msg)
2399 assert_equal(b.copy().argsort(kind=kind), rr, msg)
2400
2401 # test object array argsorts.
2402 a = np.empty((101,), dtype=object)
2403 a[:] = list(range(101))
2404 b = a[::-1]
2405 r = np.arange(101)
2406 rr = r[::-1]
2407 for kind in self.sort_kinds:
2408 msg = "object argsort, kind=%s" % kind
2409 assert_equal(a.copy().argsort(kind=kind), r, msg)
2410 assert_equal(b.copy().argsort(kind=kind), rr, msg)
2411
2412 # test structured array argsorts.
2413 dt = np.dtype([('f', float), ('i', int)])
2414 a = np.array([(i, i) for i in range(101)], dtype=dt)
2415 b = a[::-1]
2416 r = np.arange(101)
2417 rr = r[::-1]
2418 for kind in self.sort_kinds:
2419 msg = "structured array argsort, kind=%s" % kind
2420 assert_equal(a.copy().argsort(kind=kind), r, msg)
2421 assert_equal(b.copy().argsort(kind=kind), rr, msg)
2422
2423 # test datetime64 argsorts.
2424 a = np.arange(0, 101, dtype='datetime64[D]')
2425 b = a[::-1]
2426 r = np.arange(101)
2427 rr = r[::-1]
2428 for kind in ['q', 'h', 'm']:
2429 msg = "datetime64 argsort, kind=%s" % kind
2430 assert_equal(a.copy().argsort(kind=kind), r, msg)
2431 assert_equal(b.copy().argsort(kind=kind), rr, msg)
2432
2433 # test timedelta64 argsorts.
2434 a = np.arange(0, 101, dtype='timedelta64[D]')
2435 b = a[::-1]
2436 r = np.arange(101)
2437 rr = r[::-1]
2438 for kind in ['q', 'h', 'm']:
2439 msg = "timedelta64 argsort, kind=%s" % kind
2440 assert_equal(a.copy().argsort(kind=kind), r, msg)
2441 assert_equal(b.copy().argsort(kind=kind), rr, msg)
2442
2443 # check axis handling. This should be the same for all type
2444 # specific argsorts, so we only check it for one type and one kind
2445 a = np.array([[3, 2], [1, 0]])
2446 b = np.array([[1, 1], [0, 0]])
2447 c = np.array([[1, 0], [1, 0]])
2448 assert_equal(a.copy().argsort(axis=0), b)
2449 assert_equal(a.copy().argsort(axis=1), c)
2450 assert_equal(a.copy().argsort(), c)
2451
2452 # check axis handling for multidimensional empty arrays
2453 a = np.array([])
2454 a.shape = (3, 2, 1, 0)
2455 for axis in range(-a.ndim, a.ndim):
2456 msg = 'test empty array argsort with axis={0}'.format(axis)
2457 assert_equal(np.argsort(a, axis=axis),
2458 np.zeros_like(a, dtype=np.intp), msg)
2459 msg = 'test empty array argsort with axis=None'
2460 assert_equal(np.argsort(a, axis=None),
2461 np.zeros_like(a.ravel(), dtype=np.intp), msg)
2462
2463 # check that stable argsorts are stable
2464 r = np.arange(100)
2465 # scalars
2466 a = np.zeros(100)
2467 assert_equal(a.argsort(kind='m'), r)
2468 # complex
2469 a = np.zeros(100, dtype=complex)
2470 assert_equal(a.argsort(kind='m'), r)
2471 # string
2472 a = np.array(['aaaaaaaaa' for i in range(100)])
2473 assert_equal(a.argsort(kind='m'), r)
2474 # unicode
2475 a = np.array(['aaaaaaaaa' for i in range(100)], dtype=np.str_)
2476 assert_equal(a.argsort(kind='m'), r)
2477
2478 def test_sort_unicode_kind(self):
2479 d = np.arange(10)
2480 k = b'\xc3\xa4'.decode("UTF8")
2481 assert_raises(ValueError, d.sort, kind=k)
2482 assert_raises(ValueError, d.argsort, kind=k)
2483
2484 @pytest.mark.parametrize('a', [
2485 np.array([0, 1, np.nan], dtype=np.float16),
2486 np.array([0, 1, np.nan], dtype=np.float32),
2487 np.array([0, 1, np.nan]),
2488 ])
2489 def test_searchsorted_floats(self, a):
2490 # test for floats arrays containing nans. Explicitly test
2491 # half, single, and double precision floats to verify that
2492 # the NaN-handling is correct.
2493 msg = "Test real (%s) searchsorted with nans, side='l'" % a.dtype
2494 b = a.searchsorted(a, side='left')
2495 assert_equal(b, np.arange(3), msg)
2496 msg = "Test real (%s) searchsorted with nans, side='r'" % a.dtype
2497 b = a.searchsorted(a, side='right')
2498 assert_equal(b, np.arange(1, 4), msg)
2499 # check keyword arguments
2500 a.searchsorted(v=1)
2501 x = np.array([0, 1, np.nan], dtype='float32')
2502 y = np.searchsorted(x, x[-1])
2503 assert_equal(y, 2)
2504
2505 def test_searchsorted_complex(self):
2506 # test for complex arrays containing nans.
2507 # The search sorted routines use the compare functions for the
2508 # array type, so this checks if that is consistent with the sort
2509 # order.
2510 # check double complex
2511 a = np.zeros(9, dtype=np.complex128)
2512 a.real += [0, 0, 1, 1, 0, 1, np.nan, np.nan, np.nan]
2513 a.imag += [0, 1, 0, 1, np.nan, np.nan, 0, 1, np.nan]
2514 msg = "Test complex searchsorted with nans, side='l'"
2515 b = a.searchsorted(a, side='left')
2516 assert_equal(b, np.arange(9), msg)
2517 msg = "Test complex searchsorted with nans, side='r'"
2518 b = a.searchsorted(a, side='right')
2519 assert_equal(b, np.arange(1, 10), msg)
2520 msg = "Test searchsorted with little endian, side='l'"
2521 a = np.array([0, 128], dtype='<i4')
2522 b = a.searchsorted(np.array(128, dtype='<i4'))
2523 assert_equal(b, 1, msg)
2524 msg = "Test searchsorted with big endian, side='l'"
2525 a = np.array([0, 128], dtype='>i4')
2526 b = a.searchsorted(np.array(128, dtype='>i4'))
2527 assert_equal(b, 1, msg)
2528
2529 def test_searchsorted_n_elements(self):
2530 # Check 0 elements
2531 a = np.ones(0)
2532 b = a.searchsorted([0, 1, 2], 'left')
2533 assert_equal(b, [0, 0, 0])
2534 b = a.searchsorted([0, 1, 2], 'right')
2535 assert_equal(b, [0, 0, 0])
2536 a = np.ones(1)
2537 # Check 1 element
2538 b = a.searchsorted([0, 1, 2], 'left')
2539 assert_equal(b, [0, 0, 1])
2540 b = a.searchsorted([0, 1, 2], 'right')
2541 assert_equal(b, [0, 1, 1])
2542 # Check all elements equal
2543 a = np.ones(2)
2544 b = a.searchsorted([0, 1, 2], 'left')
2545 assert_equal(b, [0, 0, 2])
2546 b = a.searchsorted([0, 1, 2], 'right')
2547 assert_equal(b, [0, 2, 2])
2548
2549 def test_searchsorted_unaligned_array(self):
2550 # Test searching unaligned array
2551 a = np.arange(10)
2552 aligned = np.empty(a.itemsize * a.size + 1, 'uint8')
2553 unaligned = aligned[1:].view(a.dtype)
2554 unaligned[:] = a
2555 # Test searching unaligned array
2556 b = unaligned.searchsorted(a, 'left')
2557 assert_equal(b, a)
2558 b = unaligned.searchsorted(a, 'right')
2559 assert_equal(b, a + 1)
2560 # Test searching for unaligned keys
2561 b = a.searchsorted(unaligned, 'left')
2562 assert_equal(b, a)
2563 b = a.searchsorted(unaligned, 'right')
2564 assert_equal(b, a + 1)
2565
2566 def test_searchsorted_resetting(self):
2567 # Test smart resetting of binsearch indices
2568 a = np.arange(5)
2569 b = a.searchsorted([6, 5, 4], 'left')
2570 assert_equal(b, [5, 5, 4])
2571 b = a.searchsorted([6, 5, 4], 'right')
2572 assert_equal(b, [5, 5, 5])
2573
2574 def test_searchsorted_type_specific(self):
2575 # Test all type specific binary search functions
2576 types = ''.join((np.typecodes['AllInteger'], np.typecodes['AllFloat'],
2577 np.typecodes['Datetime'], '?O'))
2578 for dt in types:
2579 if dt == 'M':
2580 dt = 'M8[D]'
2581 if dt == '?':
2582 a = np.arange(2, dtype=dt)
2583 out = np.arange(2)
2584 else:
2585 a = np.arange(0, 5, dtype=dt)
2586 out = np.arange(5)
2587 b = a.searchsorted(a, 'left')
2588 assert_equal(b, out)
2589 b = a.searchsorted(a, 'right')
2590 assert_equal(b, out + 1)
2591 # Test empty array, use a fresh array to get warnings in
2592 # valgrind if access happens.
2593 e = np.ndarray(shape=0, buffer=b'', dtype=dt)
2594 b = e.searchsorted(a, 'left')
2595 assert_array_equal(b, np.zeros(len(a), dtype=np.intp))
2596 b = a.searchsorted(e, 'left')
2597 assert_array_equal(b, np.zeros(0, dtype=np.intp))
2598
2599 def test_searchsorted_unicode(self):
2600 # Test searchsorted on unicode strings.
2601
2602 # 1.6.1 contained a string length miscalculation in
2603 # arraytypes.c.src:UNICODE_compare() which manifested as
2604 # incorrect/inconsistent results from searchsorted.
2605 a = np.array(['P:\\20x_dapi_cy3\\20x_dapi_cy3_20100185_1',
2606 'P:\\20x_dapi_cy3\\20x_dapi_cy3_20100186_1',
2607 'P:\\20x_dapi_cy3\\20x_dapi_cy3_20100187_1',
2608 'P:\\20x_dapi_cy3\\20x_dapi_cy3_20100189_1',
2609 'P:\\20x_dapi_cy3\\20x_dapi_cy3_20100190_1',
2610 'P:\\20x_dapi_cy3\\20x_dapi_cy3_20100191_1',
2611 'P:\\20x_dapi_cy3\\20x_dapi_cy3_20100192_1',
2612 'P:\\20x_dapi_cy3\\20x_dapi_cy3_20100193_1',
2613 'P:\\20x_dapi_cy3\\20x_dapi_cy3_20100194_1',
2614 'P:\\20x_dapi_cy3\\20x_dapi_cy3_20100195_1',
2615 'P:\\20x_dapi_cy3\\20x_dapi_cy3_20100196_1',
2616 'P:\\20x_dapi_cy3\\20x_dapi_cy3_20100197_1',
2617 'P:\\20x_dapi_cy3\\20x_dapi_cy3_20100198_1',
2618 'P:\\20x_dapi_cy3\\20x_dapi_cy3_20100199_1'],
2619 dtype=np.str_)
2620 ind = np.arange(len(a))
2621 assert_equal([a.searchsorted(v, 'left') for v in a], ind)
2622 assert_equal([a.searchsorted(v, 'right') for v in a], ind + 1)
2623 assert_equal([a.searchsorted(a[i], 'left') for i in ind], ind)
2624 assert_equal([a.searchsorted(a[i], 'right') for i in ind], ind + 1)
2625
2626 def test_searchsorted_with_invalid_sorter(self):
2627 a = np.array([5, 2, 1, 3, 4])
2628 s = np.argsort(a)
2629 assert_raises(TypeError, np.searchsorted, a, 0,
2630 sorter=np.array((1, (2, 3)), dtype=object))
2631 assert_raises(TypeError, np.searchsorted, a, 0, sorter=[1.1])
2632 assert_raises(ValueError, np.searchsorted, a, 0, sorter=[1, 2, 3, 4])
2633 assert_raises(ValueError, np.searchsorted, a, 0, sorter=[1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6])
2634
2635 # bounds check
2636 assert_raises(ValueError, np.searchsorted, a, 4, sorter=[0, 1, 2, 3, 5])
2637 assert_raises(ValueError, np.searchsorted, a, 0, sorter=[-1, 0, 1, 2, 3])
2638 assert_raises(ValueError, np.searchsorted, a, 0, sorter=[4, 0, -1, 2, 3])
2639
2640 def test_searchsorted_with_sorter(self):
2641 a = np.random.rand(300)
2642 s = a.argsort()
2643 b = np.sort(a)
2644 k = np.linspace(0, 1, 20)
2645 assert_equal(b.searchsorted(k), a.searchsorted(k, sorter=s))
2646
2647 a = np.array([0, 1, 2, 3, 5]*20)
2648 s = a.argsort()
2649 k = [0, 1, 2, 3, 5]
2650 expected = [0, 20, 40, 60, 80]
2651 assert_equal(a.searchsorted(k, side='left', sorter=s), expected)
2652 expected = [20, 40, 60, 80, 100]
2653 assert_equal(a.searchsorted(k, side='right', sorter=s), expected)
2654
2655 # Test searching unaligned array
2656 keys = np.arange(10)
2657 a = keys.copy()
2658 np.random.shuffle(s)
2659 s = a.argsort()
2660 aligned = np.empty(a.itemsize * a.size + 1, 'uint8')
2661 unaligned = aligned[1:].view(a.dtype)
2662 # Test searching unaligned array
2663 unaligned[:] = a
2664 b = unaligned.searchsorted(keys, 'left', s)
2665 assert_equal(b, keys)
2666 b = unaligned.searchsorted(keys, 'right', s)
2667 assert_equal(b, keys + 1)
2668 # Test searching for unaligned keys
2669 unaligned[:] = keys
2670 b = a.searchsorted(unaligned, 'left', s)
2671 assert_equal(b, keys)
2672 b = a.searchsorted(unaligned, 'right', s)
2673 assert_equal(b, keys + 1)
2674
2675 # Test all type specific indirect binary search functions
2676 types = ''.join((np.typecodes['AllInteger'], np.typecodes['AllFloat'],
2677 np.typecodes['Datetime'], '?O'))
2678 for dt in types:
2679 if dt == 'M':
2680 dt = 'M8[D]'
2681 if dt == '?':
2682 a = np.array([1, 0], dtype=dt)
2683 # We want the sorter array to be of a type that is different
2684 # from np.intp in all platforms, to check for #4698
2685 s = np.array([1, 0], dtype=np.int16)
2686 out = np.array([1, 0])
2687 else:
2688 a = np.array([3, 4, 1, 2, 0], dtype=dt)
2689 # We want the sorter array to be of a type that is different
2690 # from np.intp in all platforms, to check for #4698
2691 s = np.array([4, 2, 3, 0, 1], dtype=np.int16)
2692 out = np.array([3, 4, 1, 2, 0], dtype=np.intp)
2693 b = a.searchsorted(a, 'left', s)
2694 assert_equal(b, out)
2695 b = a.searchsorted(a, 'right', s)
2696 assert_equal(b, out + 1)
2697 # Test empty array, use a fresh array to get warnings in
2698 # valgrind if access happens.
2699 e = np.ndarray(shape=0, buffer=b'', dtype=dt)
2700 b = e.searchsorted(a, 'left', s[:0])
2701 assert_array_equal(b, np.zeros(len(a), dtype=np.intp))
2702 b = a.searchsorted(e, 'left', s)
2703 assert_array_equal(b, np.zeros(0, dtype=np.intp))
2704
2705 # Test non-contiguous sorter array
2706 a = np.array([3, 4, 1, 2, 0])
2707 srt = np.empty((10,), dtype=np.intp)
2708 srt[1::2] = -1
2709 srt[::2] = [4, 2, 3, 0, 1]
2710 s = srt[::2]
2711 out = np.array([3, 4, 1, 2, 0], dtype=np.intp)
2712 b = a.searchsorted(a, 'left', s)
2713 assert_equal(b, out)
2714 b = a.searchsorted(a, 'right', s)
2715 assert_equal(b, out + 1)
2716
2717 def test_searchsorted_return_type(self):
2718 # Functions returning indices should always return base ndarrays
2719 class A(np.ndarray):
2720 pass
2721 a = np.arange(5).view(A)
2722 b = np.arange(1, 3).view(A)
2723 s = np.arange(5).view(A)
2724 assert_(not isinstance(a.searchsorted(b, 'left'), A))
2725 assert_(not isinstance(a.searchsorted(b, 'right'), A))
2726 assert_(not isinstance(a.searchsorted(b, 'left', s), A))
2727 assert_(not isinstance(a.searchsorted(b, 'right', s), A))
2728
2729 @pytest.mark.parametrize("dtype", np.typecodes["All"])
2730 def test_argpartition_out_of_range(self, dtype):
2731 # Test out of range values in kth raise an error, gh-5469
2732 d = np.arange(10).astype(dtype=dtype)
2733 assert_raises(ValueError, d.argpartition, 10)
2734 assert_raises(ValueError, d.argpartition, -11)
2735
2736 @pytest.mark.parametrize("dtype", np.typecodes["All"])
2737 def test_partition_out_of_range(self, dtype):
2738 # Test out of range values in kth raise an error, gh-5469
2739 d = np.arange(10).astype(dtype=dtype)
2740 assert_raises(ValueError, d.partition, 10)
2741 assert_raises(ValueError, d.partition, -11)
2742
2743 def test_argpartition_integer(self):
2744 # Test non-integer values in kth raise an error/
2745 d = np.arange(10)
2746 assert_raises(TypeError, d.argpartition, 9.)
2747 # Test also for generic type argpartition, which uses sorting
2748 # and used to not bound check kth
2749 d_obj = np.arange(10, dtype=object)
2750 assert_raises(TypeError, d_obj.argpartition, 9.)
2751
2752 def test_partition_integer(self):
2753 # Test out of range values in kth raise an error, gh-5469
2754 d = np.arange(10)
2755 assert_raises(TypeError, d.partition, 9.)
2756 # Test also for generic type partition, which uses sorting
2757 # and used to not bound check kth
2758 d_obj = np.arange(10, dtype=object)
2759 assert_raises(TypeError, d_obj.partition, 9.)
2760
2761 @pytest.mark.parametrize("kth_dtype", np.typecodes["AllInteger"])
2762 def test_partition_empty_array(self, kth_dtype):
2763 # check axis handling for multidimensional empty arrays
2764 kth = np.array(0, dtype=kth_dtype)[()]
2765 a = np.array([])
2766 a.shape = (3, 2, 1, 0)
2767 for axis in range(-a.ndim, a.ndim):
2768 msg = 'test empty array partition with axis={0}'.format(axis)
2769 assert_equal(np.partition(a, kth, axis=axis), a, msg)
2770 msg = 'test empty array partition with axis=None'
2771 assert_equal(np.partition(a, kth, axis=None), a.ravel(), msg)
2772
2773 @pytest.mark.parametrize("kth_dtype", np.typecodes["AllInteger"])
2774 def test_argpartition_empty_array(self, kth_dtype):
2775 # check axis handling for multidimensional empty arrays
2776 kth = np.array(0, dtype=kth_dtype)[()]
2777 a = np.array([])
2778 a.shape = (3, 2, 1, 0)
2779 for axis in range(-a.ndim, a.ndim):
2780 msg = 'test empty array argpartition with axis={0}'.format(axis)
2781 assert_equal(np.partition(a, kth, axis=axis),
2782 np.zeros_like(a, dtype=np.intp), msg)
2783 msg = 'test empty array argpartition with axis=None'
2784 assert_equal(np.partition(a, kth, axis=None),
2785 np.zeros_like(a.ravel(), dtype=np.intp), msg)
2786
2787 def test_partition(self):
2788 d = np.arange(10)
2789 assert_raises(TypeError, np.partition, d, 2, kind=1)
2790 assert_raises(ValueError, np.partition, d, 2, kind="nonsense")
2791 assert_raises(ValueError, np.argpartition, d, 2, kind="nonsense")
2792 assert_raises(ValueError, d.partition, 2, axis=0, kind="nonsense")
2793 assert_raises(ValueError, d.argpartition, 2, axis=0, kind="nonsense")
2794 for k in ("introselect",):
2795 d = np.array([])
2796 assert_array_equal(np.partition(d, 0, kind=k), d)
2797 assert_array_equal(np.argpartition(d, 0, kind=k), d)
2798 d = np.ones(1)
2799 assert_array_equal(np.partition(d, 0, kind=k)[0], d)
2800 assert_array_equal(d[np.argpartition(d, 0, kind=k)],
2801 np.partition(d, 0, kind=k))
2802
2803 # kth not modified
2804 kth = np.array([30, 15, 5])
2805 okth = kth.copy()
2806 np.partition(np.arange(40), kth)
2807 assert_array_equal(kth, okth)
2808
2809 for r in ([2, 1], [1, 2], [1, 1]):
2810 d = np.array(r)
2811 tgt = np.sort(d)
2812 assert_array_equal(np.partition(d, 0, kind=k)[0], tgt[0])
2813 assert_array_equal(np.partition(d, 1, kind=k)[1], tgt[1])
2814 assert_array_equal(d[np.argpartition(d, 0, kind=k)],
2815 np.partition(d, 0, kind=k))
2816 assert_array_equal(d[np.argpartition(d, 1, kind=k)],
2817 np.partition(d, 1, kind=k))
2818 for i in range(d.size):
2819 d[i:].partition(0, kind=k)
2820 assert_array_equal(d, tgt)
2821
2822 for r in ([3, 2, 1], [1, 2, 3], [2, 1, 3], [2, 3, 1],
2823 [1, 1, 1], [1, 2, 2], [2, 2, 1], [1, 2, 1]):
2824 d = np.array(r)
2825 tgt = np.sort(d)
2826 assert_array_equal(np.partition(d, 0, kind=k)[0], tgt[0])
2827 assert_array_equal(np.partition(d, 1, kind=k)[1], tgt[1])
2828 assert_array_equal(np.partition(d, 2, kind=k)[2], tgt[2])
2829 assert_array_equal(d[np.argpartition(d, 0, kind=k)],
2830 np.partition(d, 0, kind=k))
2831 assert_array_equal(d[np.argpartition(d, 1, kind=k)],
2832 np.partition(d, 1, kind=k))
2833 assert_array_equal(d[np.argpartition(d, 2, kind=k)],
2834 np.partition(d, 2, kind=k))
2835 for i in range(d.size):
2836 d[i:].partition(0, kind=k)
2837 assert_array_equal(d, tgt)
2838
2839 d = np.ones(50)
2840 assert_array_equal(np.partition(d, 0, kind=k), d)
2841 assert_array_equal(d[np.argpartition(d, 0, kind=k)],
2842 np.partition(d, 0, kind=k))
2843
2844 # sorted
2845 d = np.arange(49)
2846 assert_equal(np.partition(d, 5, kind=k)[5], 5)
2847 assert_equal(np.partition(d, 15, kind=k)[15], 15)
2848 assert_array_equal(d[np.argpartition(d, 5, kind=k)],
2849 np.partition(d, 5, kind=k))
2850 assert_array_equal(d[np.argpartition(d, 15, kind=k)],
2851 np.partition(d, 15, kind=k))
2852
2853 # rsorted
2854 d = np.arange(47)[::-1]
2855 assert_equal(np.partition(d, 6, kind=k)[6], 6)
2856 assert_equal(np.partition(d, 16, kind=k)[16], 16)
2857 assert_array_equal(d[np.argpartition(d, 6, kind=k)],
2858 np.partition(d, 6, kind=k))
2859 assert_array_equal(d[np.argpartition(d, 16, kind=k)],
2860 np.partition(d, 16, kind=k))
2861
2862 assert_array_equal(np.partition(d, -6, kind=k),
2863 np.partition(d, 41, kind=k))
2864 assert_array_equal(np.partition(d, -16, kind=k),
2865 np.partition(d, 31, kind=k))
2866 assert_array_equal(d[np.argpartition(d, -6, kind=k)],
2867 np.partition(d, 41, kind=k))
2868
2869 # median of 3 killer, O(n^2) on pure median 3 pivot quickselect
2870 # exercises the median of median of 5 code used to keep O(n)
2871 d = np.arange(1000000)
2872 x = np.roll(d, d.size // 2)
2873 mid = x.size // 2 + 1
2874 assert_equal(np.partition(x, mid)[mid], mid)
2875 d = np.arange(1000001)
2876 x = np.roll(d, d.size // 2 + 1)
2877 mid = x.size // 2 + 1
2878 assert_equal(np.partition(x, mid)[mid], mid)
2879
2880 # max
2881 d = np.ones(10)
2882 d[1] = 4
2883 assert_equal(np.partition(d, (2, -1))[-1], 4)
2884 assert_equal(np.partition(d, (2, -1))[2], 1)
2885 assert_equal(d[np.argpartition(d, (2, -1))][-1], 4)
2886 assert_equal(d[np.argpartition(d, (2, -1))][2], 1)
2887 d[1] = np.nan
2888 assert_(np.isnan(d[np.argpartition(d, (2, -1))][-1]))
2889 assert_(np.isnan(np.partition(d, (2, -1))[-1]))
2890
2891 # equal elements
2892 d = np.arange(47) % 7
2893 tgt = np.sort(np.arange(47) % 7)
2894 np.random.shuffle(d)
2895 for i in range(d.size):
2896 assert_equal(np.partition(d, i, kind=k)[i], tgt[i])
2897 assert_array_equal(d[np.argpartition(d, 6, kind=k)],
2898 np.partition(d, 6, kind=k))
2899 assert_array_equal(d[np.argpartition(d, 16, kind=k)],
2900 np.partition(d, 16, kind=k))
2901 for i in range(d.size):
2902 d[i:].partition(0, kind=k)
2903 assert_array_equal(d, tgt)
2904
2905 d = np.array([0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 7, 7, 7, 7, 7, 7, 7, 7, 7, 7, 7,
2906 7, 7, 7, 7, 7, 9])
2907 kth = [0, 3, 19, 20]
2908 assert_equal(np.partition(d, kth, kind=k)[kth], (0, 3, 7, 7))
2909 assert_equal(d[np.argpartition(d, kth, kind=k)][kth], (0, 3, 7, 7))
2910
2911 d = np.array([2, 1])
2912 d.partition(0, kind=k)
2913 assert_raises(ValueError, d.partition, 2)
2914 assert_raises(np.AxisError, d.partition, 3, axis=1)
2915 assert_raises(ValueError, np.partition, d, 2)
2916 assert_raises(np.AxisError, np.partition, d, 2, axis=1)
2917 assert_raises(ValueError, d.argpartition, 2)
2918 assert_raises(np.AxisError, d.argpartition, 3, axis=1)
2919 assert_raises(ValueError, np.argpartition, d, 2)
2920 assert_raises(np.AxisError, np.argpartition, d, 2, axis=1)
2921 d = np.arange(10).reshape((2, 5))
2922 d.partition(1, axis=0, kind=k)
2923 d.partition(4, axis=1, kind=k)
2924 np.partition(d, 1, axis=0, kind=k)
2925 np.partition(d, 4, axis=1, kind=k)
2926 np.partition(d, 1, axis=None, kind=k)
2927 np.partition(d, 9, axis=None, kind=k)
2928 d.argpartition(1, axis=0, kind=k)
2929 d.argpartition(4, axis=1, kind=k)
2930 np.argpartition(d, 1, axis=0, kind=k)
2931 np.argpartition(d, 4, axis=1, kind=k)
2932 np.argpartition(d, 1, axis=None, kind=k)
2933 np.argpartition(d, 9, axis=None, kind=k)
2934 assert_raises(ValueError, d.partition, 2, axis=0)
2935 assert_raises(ValueError, d.partition, 11, axis=1)
2936 assert_raises(TypeError, d.partition, 2, axis=None)
2937 assert_raises(ValueError, np.partition, d, 9, axis=1)
2938 assert_raises(ValueError, np.partition, d, 11, axis=None)
2939 assert_raises(ValueError, d.argpartition, 2, axis=0)
2940 assert_raises(ValueError, d.argpartition, 11, axis=1)
2941 assert_raises(ValueError, np.argpartition, d, 9, axis=1)
2942 assert_raises(ValueError, np.argpartition, d, 11, axis=None)
2943
2944 td = [(dt, s) for dt in [np.int32, np.float32, np.complex64]
2945 for s in (9, 16)]
2946 for dt, s in td:
2947 aae = assert_array_equal
2948 at = assert_
2949
2950 d = np.arange(s, dtype=dt)
2951 np.random.shuffle(d)
2952 d1 = np.tile(np.arange(s, dtype=dt), (4, 1))
2953 map(np.random.shuffle, d1)
2954 d0 = np.transpose(d1)
2955 for i in range(d.size):
2956 p = np.partition(d, i, kind=k)
2957 assert_equal(p[i], i)
2958 # all before are smaller
2959 assert_array_less(p[:i], p[i])
2960 # all after are larger
2961 assert_array_less(p[i], p[i + 1:])
2962 aae(p, d[np.argpartition(d, i, kind=k)])
2963
2964 p = np.partition(d1, i, axis=1, kind=k)
2965 aae(p[:, i], np.array([i] * d1.shape[0], dtype=dt))
2966 # array_less does not seem to work right
2967 at((p[:, :i].T <= p[:, i]).all(),
2968 msg="%d: %r <= %r" % (i, p[:, i], p[:, :i].T))
2969 at((p[:, i + 1:].T > p[:, i]).all(),
2970 msg="%d: %r < %r" % (i, p[:, i], p[:, i + 1:].T))
2971 aae(p, d1[np.arange(d1.shape[0])[:, None],
2972 np.argpartition(d1, i, axis=1, kind=k)])
2973
2974 p = np.partition(d0, i, axis=0, kind=k)
2975 aae(p[i, :], np.array([i] * d1.shape[0], dtype=dt))
2976 # array_less does not seem to work right
2977 at((p[:i, :] <= p[i, :]).all(),
2978 msg="%d: %r <= %r" % (i, p[i, :], p[:i, :]))
2979 at((p[i + 1:, :] > p[i, :]).all(),
2980 msg="%d: %r < %r" % (i, p[i, :], p[:, i + 1:]))
2981 aae(p, d0[np.argpartition(d0, i, axis=0, kind=k),
2982 np.arange(d0.shape[1])[None, :]])
2983
2984 # check inplace
2985 dc = d.copy()
2986 dc.partition(i, kind=k)
2987 assert_equal(dc, np.partition(d, i, kind=k))
2988 dc = d0.copy()
2989 dc.partition(i, axis=0, kind=k)
2990 assert_equal(dc, np.partition(d0, i, axis=0, kind=k))
2991 dc = d1.copy()
2992 dc.partition(i, axis=1, kind=k)
2993 assert_equal(dc, np.partition(d1, i, axis=1, kind=k))
2994
2995 def assert_partitioned(self, d, kth):
2996 prev = 0
2997 for k in np.sort(kth):
2998 assert_array_less(d[prev:k], d[k], err_msg='kth %d' % k)
2999 assert_((d[k:] >= d[k]).all(),
3000 msg="kth %d, %r not greater equal %d" % (k, d[k:], d[k]))
3001 prev = k + 1
3002
3003 def test_partition_iterative(self):
3004 d = np.arange(17)
3005 kth = (0, 1, 2, 429, 231)
3006 assert_raises(ValueError, d.partition, kth)
3007 assert_raises(ValueError, d.argpartition, kth)
3008 d = np.arange(10).reshape((2, 5))
3009 assert_raises(ValueError, d.partition, kth, axis=0)
3010 assert_raises(ValueError, d.partition, kth, axis=1)
3011 assert_raises(ValueError, np.partition, d, kth, axis=1)
3012 assert_raises(ValueError, np.partition, d, kth, axis=None)
3013
3014 d = np.array([3, 4, 2, 1])
3015 p = np.partition(d, (0, 3))
3016 self.assert_partitioned(p, (0, 3))
3017 self.assert_partitioned(d[np.argpartition(d, (0, 3))], (0, 3))
3018
3019 assert_array_equal(p, np.partition(d, (-3, -1)))
3020 assert_array_equal(p, d[np.argpartition(d, (-3, -1))])
3021
3022 d = np.arange(17)
3023 np.random.shuffle(d)
3024 d.partition(range(d.size))
3025 assert_array_equal(np.arange(17), d)
3026 np.random.shuffle(d)
3027 assert_array_equal(np.arange(17), d[d.argpartition(range(d.size))])
3028
3029 # test unsorted kth
3030 d = np.arange(17)
3031 np.random.shuffle(d)
3032 keys = np.array([1, 3, 8, -2])
3033 np.random.shuffle(d)
3034 p = np.partition(d, keys)
3035 self.assert_partitioned(p, keys)
3036 p = d[np.argpartition(d, keys)]
3037 self.assert_partitioned(p, keys)
3038 np.random.shuffle(keys)
3039 assert_array_equal(np.partition(d, keys), p)
3040 assert_array_equal(d[np.argpartition(d, keys)], p)
3041
3042 # equal kth
3043 d = np.arange(20)[::-1]
3044 self.assert_partitioned(np.partition(d, [5]*4), [5])
3045 self.assert_partitioned(np.partition(d, [5]*4 + [6, 13]),
3046 [5]*4 + [6, 13])
3047 self.assert_partitioned(d[np.argpartition(d, [5]*4)], [5])
3048 self.assert_partitioned(d[np.argpartition(d, [5]*4 + [6, 13])],
3049 [5]*4 + [6, 13])
3050
3051 d = np.arange(12)
3052 np.random.shuffle(d)
3053 d1 = np.tile(np.arange(12), (4, 1))
3054 map(np.random.shuffle, d1)
3055 d0 = np.transpose(d1)
3056
3057 kth = (1, 6, 7, -1)
3058 p = np.partition(d1, kth, axis=1)
3059 pa = d1[np.arange(d1.shape[0])[:, None],
3060 d1.argpartition(kth, axis=1)]
3061 assert_array_equal(p, pa)
3062 for i in range(d1.shape[0]):
3063 self.assert_partitioned(p[i,:], kth)
3064 p = np.partition(d0, kth, axis=0)
3065 pa = d0[np.argpartition(d0, kth, axis=0),
3066 np.arange(d0.shape[1])[None,:]]
3067 assert_array_equal(p, pa)
3068 for i in range(d0.shape[1]):
3069 self.assert_partitioned(p[:, i], kth)
3070
3071 def test_partition_cdtype(self):
3072 d = np.array([('Galahad', 1.7, 38), ('Arthur', 1.8, 41),
3073 ('Lancelot', 1.9, 38)],
3074 dtype=[('name', '|S10'), ('height', '<f8'), ('age', '<i4')])
3075
3076 tgt = np.sort(d, order=['age', 'height'])
3077 assert_array_equal(np.partition(d, range(d.size),
3078 order=['age', 'height']),
3079 tgt)
3080 assert_array_equal(d[np.argpartition(d, range(d.size),
3081 order=['age', 'height'])],
3082 tgt)
3083 for k in range(d.size):
3084 assert_equal(np.partition(d, k, order=['age', 'height'])[k],
3085 tgt[k])
3086 assert_equal(d[np.argpartition(d, k, order=['age', 'height'])][k],
3087 tgt[k])
3088
3089 d = np.array(['Galahad', 'Arthur', 'zebra', 'Lancelot'])
3090 tgt = np.sort(d)
3091 assert_array_equal(np.partition(d, range(d.size)), tgt)
3092 for k in range(d.size):
3093 assert_equal(np.partition(d, k)[k], tgt[k])
3094 assert_equal(d[np.argpartition(d, k)][k], tgt[k])
3095
3096 def test_partition_unicode_kind(self):
3097 d = np.arange(10)
3098 k = b'\xc3\xa4'.decode("UTF8")
3099 assert_raises(ValueError, d.partition, 2, kind=k)
3100 assert_raises(ValueError, d.argpartition, 2, kind=k)
3101
3102 def test_partition_fuzz(self):
3103 # a few rounds of random data testing
3104 for j in range(10, 30):
3105 for i in range(1, j - 2):
3106 d = np.arange(j)
3107 np.random.shuffle(d)
3108 d = d % np.random.randint(2, 30)
3109 idx = np.random.randint(d.size)
3110 kth = [0, idx, i, i + 1]
3111 tgt = np.sort(d)[kth]
3112 assert_array_equal(np.partition(d, kth)[kth], tgt,
3113 err_msg="data: %r\n kth: %r" % (d, kth))
3114
3115 @pytest.mark.parametrize("kth_dtype", np.typecodes["AllInteger"])
3116 def test_argpartition_gh5524(self, kth_dtype):
3117 # A test for functionality of argpartition on lists.
3118 kth = np.array(1, dtype=kth_dtype)[()]
3119 d = [6, 7, 3, 2, 9, 0]
3120 p = np.argpartition(d, kth)
3121 self.assert_partitioned(np.array(d)[p],[1])
3122
3123 def test_flatten(self):
3124 x0 = np.array([[1, 2, 3], [4, 5, 6]], np.int32)
3125 x1 = np.array([[[1, 2], [3, 4]], [[5, 6], [7, 8]]], np.int32)
3126 y0 = np.array([1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6], np.int32)
3127 y0f = np.array([1, 4, 2, 5, 3, 6], np.int32)
3128 y1 = np.array([1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8], np.int32)
3129 y1f = np.array([1, 5, 3, 7, 2, 6, 4, 8], np.int32)
3130 assert_equal(x0.flatten(), y0)
3131 assert_equal(x0.flatten('F'), y0f)
3132 assert_equal(x0.flatten('F'), x0.T.flatten())
3133 assert_equal(x1.flatten(), y1)
3134 assert_equal(x1.flatten('F'), y1f)
3135 assert_equal(x1.flatten('F'), x1.T.flatten())
3136
3137
3138 @pytest.mark.parametrize('func', (np.dot, np.matmul))
3139 def test_arr_mult(self, func):
3140 a = np.array([[1, 0], [0, 1]])
3141 b = np.array([[0, 1], [1, 0]])
3142 c = np.array([[9, 1], [1, -9]])
3143 d = np.arange(24).reshape(4, 6)
3144 ddt = np.array(
3145 [[ 55, 145, 235, 325],
3146 [ 145, 451, 757, 1063],
3147 [ 235, 757, 1279, 1801],
3148 [ 325, 1063, 1801, 2539]]
3149 )
3150 dtd = np.array(
3151 [[504, 540, 576, 612, 648, 684],
3152 [540, 580, 620, 660, 700, 740],
3153 [576, 620, 664, 708, 752, 796],
3154 [612, 660, 708, 756, 804, 852],
3155 [648, 700, 752, 804, 856, 908],
3156 [684, 740, 796, 852, 908, 964]]
3157 )
3158
3159
3160 # gemm vs syrk optimizations
3161 for et in [np.float32, np.float64, np.complex64, np.complex128]:
3162 eaf = a.astype(et)
3163 assert_equal(func(eaf, eaf), eaf)
3164 assert_equal(func(eaf.T, eaf), eaf)
3165 assert_equal(func(eaf, eaf.T), eaf)
3166 assert_equal(func(eaf.T, eaf.T), eaf)
3167 assert_equal(func(eaf.T.copy(), eaf), eaf)
3168 assert_equal(func(eaf, eaf.T.copy()), eaf)
3169 assert_equal(func(eaf.T.copy(), eaf.T.copy()), eaf)
3170
3171 # syrk validations
3172 for et in [np.float32, np.float64, np.complex64, np.complex128]:
3173 eaf = a.astype(et)
3174 ebf = b.astype(et)
3175 assert_equal(func(ebf, ebf), eaf)
3176 assert_equal(func(ebf.T, ebf), eaf)
3177 assert_equal(func(ebf, ebf.T), eaf)
3178 assert_equal(func(ebf.T, ebf.T), eaf)
3179
3180 # syrk - different shape, stride, and view validations
3181 for et in [np.float32, np.float64, np.complex64, np.complex128]:
3182 edf = d.astype(et)
3183 assert_equal(
3184 func(edf[::-1, :], edf.T),
3185 func(edf[::-1, :].copy(), edf.T.copy())
3186 )
3187 assert_equal(
3188 func(edf[:, ::-1], edf.T),
3189 func(edf[:, ::-1].copy(), edf.T.copy())
3190 )
3191 assert_equal(
3192 func(edf, edf[::-1, :].T),
3193 func(edf, edf[::-1, :].T.copy())
3194 )
3195 assert_equal(
3196 func(edf, edf[:, ::-1].T),
3197 func(edf, edf[:, ::-1].T.copy())
3198 )
3199 assert_equal(
3200 func(edf[:edf.shape[0] // 2, :], edf[::2, :].T),
3201 func(edf[:edf.shape[0] // 2, :].copy(), edf[::2, :].T.copy())
3202 )
3203 assert_equal(
3204 func(edf[::2, :], edf[:edf.shape[0] // 2, :].T),
3205 func(edf[::2, :].copy(), edf[:edf.shape[0] // 2, :].T.copy())
3206 )
3207
3208 # syrk - different shape
3209 for et in [np.float32, np.float64, np.complex64, np.complex128]:
3210 edf = d.astype(et)
3211 eddtf = ddt.astype(et)
3212 edtdf = dtd.astype(et)
3213 assert_equal(func(edf, edf.T), eddtf)
3214 assert_equal(func(edf.T, edf), edtdf)
3215
3216 @pytest.mark.parametrize('func', (np.dot, np.matmul))
3217 @pytest.mark.parametrize('dtype', 'ifdFD')
3218 def test_no_dgemv(self, func, dtype):
3219 # check vector arg for contiguous before gemv
3220 # gh-12156
3221 a = np.arange(8.0, dtype=dtype).reshape(2, 4)
3222 b = np.broadcast_to(1., (4, 1))
3223 ret1 = func(a, b)
3224 ret2 = func(a, b.copy())
3225 assert_equal(ret1, ret2)
3226
3227 ret1 = func(b.T, a.T)
3228 ret2 = func(b.T.copy(), a.T)
3229 assert_equal(ret1, ret2)
3230
3231 # check for unaligned data
3232 dt = np.dtype(dtype)
3233 a = np.zeros(8 * dt.itemsize // 2 + 1, dtype='int16')[1:].view(dtype)
3234 a = a.reshape(2, 4)
3235 b = a[0]
3236 # make sure it is not aligned
3237 assert_(a.__array_interface__['data'][0] % dt.itemsize != 0)
3238 ret1 = func(a, b)
3239 ret2 = func(a.copy(), b.copy())
3240 assert_equal(ret1, ret2)
3241
3242 ret1 = func(b.T, a.T)
3243 ret2 = func(b.T.copy(), a.T.copy())
3244 assert_equal(ret1, ret2)
3245
3246 def test_dot(self):
3247 a = np.array([[1, 0], [0, 1]])
3248 b = np.array([[0, 1], [1, 0]])
3249 c = np.array([[9, 1], [1, -9]])
3250 # function versus methods
3251 assert_equal(np.dot(a, b), a.dot(b))
3252 assert_equal(np.dot(np.dot(a, b), c), a.dot(b).dot(c))
3253
3254 # test passing in an output array
3255 c = np.zeros_like(a)
3256 a.dot(b, c)
3257 assert_equal(c, np.dot(a, b))
3258
3259 # test keyword args
3260 c = np.zeros_like(a)
3261 a.dot(b=b, out=c)
3262 assert_equal(c, np.dot(a, b))
3263
3264 def test_dot_type_mismatch(self):
3265 c = 1.
3266 A = np.array((1,1), dtype='i,i')
3267
3268 assert_raises(TypeError, np.dot, c, A)
3269 assert_raises(TypeError, np.dot, A, c)
3270
3271 def test_dot_out_mem_overlap(self):
3272 np.random.seed(1)
3273
3274 # Test BLAS and non-BLAS code paths, including all dtypes
3275 # that dot() supports
3276 dtypes = [np.dtype(code) for code in np.typecodes['All']
3277 if code not in 'USVM']
3278 for dtype in dtypes:
3279 a = np.random.rand(3, 3).astype(dtype)
3280
3281 # Valid dot() output arrays must be aligned
3282 b = _aligned_zeros((3, 3), dtype=dtype)
3283 b[...] = np.random.rand(3, 3)
3284
3285 y = np.dot(a, b)
3286 x = np.dot(a, b, out=b)
3287 assert_equal(x, y, err_msg=repr(dtype))
3288
3289 # Check invalid output array
3290 assert_raises(ValueError, np.dot, a, b, out=b[::2])
3291 assert_raises(ValueError, np.dot, a, b, out=b.T)
3292
3293 def test_dot_matmul_out(self):
3294 # gh-9641
3295 class Sub(np.ndarray):
3296 pass
3297 a = np.ones((2, 2)).view(Sub)
3298 b = np.ones((2, 2)).view(Sub)
3299 out = np.ones((2, 2))
3300
3301 # make sure out can be any ndarray (not only subclass of inputs)
3302 np.dot(a, b, out=out)
3303 np.matmul(a, b, out=out)
3304
3305 def test_dot_matmul_inner_array_casting_fails(self):
3306
3307 class A:
3308 def __array__(self, *args, **kwargs):
3309 raise NotImplementedError
3310
3311 # Don't override the error from calling __array__()
3312 assert_raises(NotImplementedError, np.dot, A(), A())
3313 assert_raises(NotImplementedError, np.matmul, A(), A())
3314 assert_raises(NotImplementedError, np.inner, A(), A())
3315
3316 def test_matmul_out(self):
3317 # overlapping memory
3318 a = np.arange(18).reshape(2, 3, 3)
3319 b = np.matmul(a, a)
3320 c = np.matmul(a, a, out=a)
3321 assert_(c is a)
3322 assert_equal(c, b)
3323 a = np.arange(18).reshape(2, 3, 3)
3324 c = np.matmul(a, a, out=a[::-1, ...])
3325 assert_(c.base is a.base)
3326 assert_equal(c, b)
3327
3328 def test_diagonal(self):
3329 a = np.arange(12).reshape((3, 4))
3330 assert_equal(a.diagonal(), [0, 5, 10])
3331 assert_equal(a.diagonal(0), [0, 5, 10])
3332 assert_equal(a.diagonal(1), [1, 6, 11])
3333 assert_equal(a.diagonal(-1), [4, 9])
3334 assert_raises(np.AxisError, a.diagonal, axis1=0, axis2=5)
3335 assert_raises(np.AxisError, a.diagonal, axis1=5, axis2=0)
3336 assert_raises(np.AxisError, a.diagonal, axis1=5, axis2=5)
3337 assert_raises(ValueError, a.diagonal, axis1=1, axis2=1)
3338
3339 b = np.arange(8).reshape((2, 2, 2))
3340 assert_equal(b.diagonal(), [[0, 6], [1, 7]])
3341 assert_equal(b.diagonal(0), [[0, 6], [1, 7]])
3342 assert_equal(b.diagonal(1), [[2], [3]])
3343 assert_equal(b.diagonal(-1), [[4], [5]])
3344 assert_raises(ValueError, b.diagonal, axis1=0, axis2=0)
3345 assert_equal(b.diagonal(0, 1, 2), [[0, 3], [4, 7]])
3346 assert_equal(b.diagonal(0, 0, 1), [[0, 6], [1, 7]])
3347 assert_equal(b.diagonal(offset=1, axis1=0, axis2=2), [[1], [3]])
3348 # Order of axis argument doesn't matter:
3349 assert_equal(b.diagonal(0, 2, 1), [[0, 3], [4, 7]])
3350
3351 def test_diagonal_view_notwriteable(self):
3352 a = np.eye(3).diagonal()
3353 assert_(not a.flags.writeable)
3354 assert_(not a.flags.owndata)
3355
3356 a = np.diagonal(np.eye(3))
3357 assert_(not a.flags.writeable)
3358 assert_(not a.flags.owndata)
3359
3360 a = np.diag(np.eye(3))
3361 assert_(not a.flags.writeable)
3362 assert_(not a.flags.owndata)
3363
3364 def test_diagonal_memleak(self):
3365 # Regression test for a bug that crept in at one point
3366 a = np.zeros((100, 100))
3367 if HAS_REFCOUNT:
3368 assert_(sys.getrefcount(a) < 50)
3369 for i in range(100):
3370 a.diagonal()
3371 if HAS_REFCOUNT:
3372 assert_(sys.getrefcount(a) < 50)
3373
3374 def test_size_zero_memleak(self):
3375 # Regression test for issue 9615
3376 # Exercises a special-case code path for dot products of length
3377 # zero in cblasfuncs (making it is specific to floating dtypes).
3378 a = np.array([], dtype=np.float64)
3379 x = np.array(2.0)
3380 for _ in range(100):
3381 np.dot(a, a, out=x)
3382 if HAS_REFCOUNT:
3383 assert_(sys.getrefcount(x) < 50)
3384
3385 def test_trace(self):
3386 a = np.arange(12).reshape((3, 4))
3387 assert_equal(a.trace(), 15)
3388 assert_equal(a.trace(0), 15)
3389 assert_equal(a.trace(1), 18)
3390 assert_equal(a.trace(-1), 13)
3391
3392 b = np.arange(8).reshape((2, 2, 2))
3393 assert_equal(b.trace(), [6, 8])
3394 assert_equal(b.trace(0), [6, 8])
3395 assert_equal(b.trace(1), [2, 3])
3396 assert_equal(b.trace(-1), [4, 5])
3397 assert_equal(b.trace(0, 0, 1), [6, 8])
3398 assert_equal(b.trace(0, 0, 2), [5, 9])
3399 assert_equal(b.trace(0, 1, 2), [3, 11])
3400 assert_equal(b.trace(offset=1, axis1=0, axis2=2), [1, 3])
3401
3402 out = np.array(1)
3403 ret = a.trace(out=out)
3404 assert ret is out
3405
3406 def test_trace_subclass(self):
3407 # The class would need to overwrite trace to ensure single-element
3408 # output also has the right subclass.
3409 class MyArray(np.ndarray):
3410 pass
3411
3412 b = np.arange(8).reshape((2, 2, 2)).view(MyArray)
3413 t = b.trace()
3414 assert_(isinstance(t, MyArray))
3415
3416 def test_put(self):
3417 icodes = np.typecodes['AllInteger']
3418 fcodes = np.typecodes['AllFloat']
3419 for dt in icodes + fcodes + 'O':
3420 tgt = np.array([0, 1, 0, 3, 0, 5], dtype=dt)
3421
3422 # test 1-d
3423 a = np.zeros(6, dtype=dt)
3424 a.put([1, 3, 5], [1, 3, 5])
3425 assert_equal(a, tgt)
3426
3427 # test 2-d
3428 a = np.zeros((2, 3), dtype=dt)
3429 a.put([1, 3, 5], [1, 3, 5])
3430 assert_equal(a, tgt.reshape(2, 3))
3431
3432 for dt in '?':
3433 tgt = np.array([False, True, False, True, False, True], dtype=dt)
3434
3435 # test 1-d
3436 a = np.zeros(6, dtype=dt)
3437 a.put([1, 3, 5], [True]*3)
3438 assert_equal(a, tgt)
3439
3440 # test 2-d
3441 a = np.zeros((2, 3), dtype=dt)
3442 a.put([1, 3, 5], [True]*3)
3443 assert_equal(a, tgt.reshape(2, 3))
3444
3445 # check must be writeable
3446 a = np.zeros(6)
3447 a.flags.writeable = False
3448 assert_raises(ValueError, a.put, [1, 3, 5], [1, 3, 5])
3449
3450 # when calling np.put, make sure a
3451 # TypeError is raised if the object
3452 # isn't an ndarray
3453 bad_array = [1, 2, 3]
3454 assert_raises(TypeError, np.put, bad_array, [0, 2], 5)
3455
3456 def test_ravel(self):
3457 a = np.array([[0, 1], [2, 3]])
3458 assert_equal(a.ravel(), [0, 1, 2, 3])
3459 assert_(not a.ravel().flags.owndata)
3460 assert_equal(a.ravel('F'), [0, 2, 1, 3])
3461 assert_equal(a.ravel(order='C'), [0, 1, 2, 3])
3462 assert_equal(a.ravel(order='F'), [0, 2, 1, 3])
3463 assert_equal(a.ravel(order='A'), [0, 1, 2, 3])
3464 assert_(not a.ravel(order='A').flags.owndata)
3465 assert_equal(a.ravel(order='K'), [0, 1, 2, 3])
3466 assert_(not a.ravel(order='K').flags.owndata)
3467 assert_equal(a.ravel(), a.reshape(-1))
3468
3469 a = np.array([[0, 1], [2, 3]], order='F')
3470 assert_equal(a.ravel(), [0, 1, 2, 3])
3471 assert_equal(a.ravel(order='A'), [0, 2, 1, 3])
3472 assert_equal(a.ravel(order='K'), [0, 2, 1, 3])
3473 assert_(not a.ravel(order='A').flags.owndata)
3474 assert_(not a.ravel(order='K').flags.owndata)
3475 assert_equal(a.ravel(), a.reshape(-1))
3476 assert_equal(a.ravel(order='A'), a.reshape(-1, order='A'))
3477
3478 a = np.array([[0, 1], [2, 3]])[::-1, :]
3479 assert_equal(a.ravel(), [2, 3, 0, 1])
3480 assert_equal(a.ravel(order='C'), [2, 3, 0, 1])
3481 assert_equal(a.ravel(order='F'), [2, 0, 3, 1])
3482 assert_equal(a.ravel(order='A'), [2, 3, 0, 1])
3483 # 'K' doesn't reverse the axes of negative strides
3484 assert_equal(a.ravel(order='K'), [2, 3, 0, 1])
3485 assert_(a.ravel(order='K').flags.owndata)
3486
3487 # Test simple 1-d copy behaviour:
3488 a = np.arange(10)[::2]
3489 assert_(a.ravel('K').flags.owndata)
3490 assert_(a.ravel('C').flags.owndata)
3491 assert_(a.ravel('F').flags.owndata)
3492
3493 # Not contiguous and 1-sized axis with non matching stride
3494 a = np.arange(2**3 * 2)[::2]
3495 a = a.reshape(2, 1, 2, 2).swapaxes(-1, -2)
3496 strides = list(a.strides)
3497 strides[1] = 123
3498 a.strides = strides
3499 assert_(a.ravel(order='K').flags.owndata)
3500 assert_equal(a.ravel('K'), np.arange(0, 15, 2))
3501
3502 # contiguous and 1-sized axis with non matching stride works:
3503 a = np.arange(2**3)
3504 a = a.reshape(2, 1, 2, 2).swapaxes(-1, -2)
3505 strides = list(a.strides)
3506 strides[1] = 123
3507 a.strides = strides
3508 assert_(np.may_share_memory(a.ravel(order='K'), a))
3509 assert_equal(a.ravel(order='K'), np.arange(2**3))
3510
3511 # Test negative strides (not very interesting since non-contiguous):
3512 a = np.arange(4)[::-1].reshape(2, 2)
3513 assert_(a.ravel(order='C').flags.owndata)
3514 assert_(a.ravel(order='K').flags.owndata)
3515 assert_equal(a.ravel('C'), [3, 2, 1, 0])
3516 assert_equal(a.ravel('K'), [3, 2, 1, 0])
3517
3518 # 1-element tidy strides test:
3519 a = np.array([[1]])
3520 a.strides = (123, 432)
3521 # If the following stride is not 8, NPY_RELAXED_STRIDES_DEBUG is
3522 # messing them up on purpose:
3523 if np.ones(1).strides == (8,):
3524 assert_(np.may_share_memory(a.ravel('K'), a))
3525 assert_equal(a.ravel('K').strides, (a.dtype.itemsize,))
3526
3527 for order in ('C', 'F', 'A', 'K'):
3528 # 0-d corner case:
3529 a = np.array(0)
3530 assert_equal(a.ravel(order), [0])
3531 assert_(np.may_share_memory(a.ravel(order), a))
3532
3533 # Test that certain non-inplace ravels work right (mostly) for 'K':
3534 b = np.arange(2**4 * 2)[::2].reshape(2, 2, 2, 2)
3535 a = b[..., ::2]
3536 assert_equal(a.ravel('K'), [0, 4, 8, 12, 16, 20, 24, 28])
3537 assert_equal(a.ravel('C'), [0, 4, 8, 12, 16, 20, 24, 28])
3538 assert_equal(a.ravel('A'), [0, 4, 8, 12, 16, 20, 24, 28])
3539 assert_equal(a.ravel('F'), [0, 16, 8, 24, 4, 20, 12, 28])
3540
3541 a = b[::2, ...]
3542 assert_equal(a.ravel('K'), [0, 2, 4, 6, 8, 10, 12, 14])
3543 assert_equal(a.ravel('C'), [0, 2, 4, 6, 8, 10, 12, 14])
3544 assert_equal(a.ravel('A'), [0, 2, 4, 6, 8, 10, 12, 14])
3545 assert_equal(a.ravel('F'), [0, 8, 4, 12, 2, 10, 6, 14])
3546
3547 def test_ravel_subclass(self):
3548 class ArraySubclass(np.ndarray):
3549 pass
3550
3551 a = np.arange(10).view(ArraySubclass)
3552 assert_(isinstance(a.ravel('C'), ArraySubclass))
3553 assert_(isinstance(a.ravel('F'), ArraySubclass))
3554 assert_(isinstance(a.ravel('A'), ArraySubclass))
3555 assert_(isinstance(a.ravel('K'), ArraySubclass))
3556
3557 a = np.arange(10)[::2].view(ArraySubclass)
3558 assert_(isinstance(a.ravel('C'), ArraySubclass))
3559 assert_(isinstance(a.ravel('F'), ArraySubclass))
3560 assert_(isinstance(a.ravel('A'), ArraySubclass))
3561 assert_(isinstance(a.ravel('K'), ArraySubclass))
3562
3563 def test_swapaxes(self):
3564 a = np.arange(1*2*3*4).reshape(1, 2, 3, 4).copy()
3565 idx = np.indices(a.shape)
3566 assert_(a.flags['OWNDATA'])
3567 b = a.copy()
3568 # check exceptions
3569 assert_raises(np.AxisError, a.swapaxes, -5, 0)
3570 assert_raises(np.AxisError, a.swapaxes, 4, 0)
3571 assert_raises(np.AxisError, a.swapaxes, 0, -5)
3572 assert_raises(np.AxisError, a.swapaxes, 0, 4)
3573
3574 for i in range(-4, 4):
3575 for j in range(-4, 4):
3576 for k, src in enumerate((a, b)):
3577 c = src.swapaxes(i, j)
3578 # check shape
3579 shape = list(src.shape)
3580 shape[i] = src.shape[j]
3581 shape[j] = src.shape[i]
3582 assert_equal(c.shape, shape, str((i, j, k)))
3583 # check array contents
3584 i0, i1, i2, i3 = [dim-1 for dim in c.shape]
3585 j0, j1, j2, j3 = [dim-1 for dim in src.shape]
3586 assert_equal(src[idx[j0], idx[j1], idx[j2], idx[j3]],
3587 c[idx[i0], idx[i1], idx[i2], idx[i3]],
3588 str((i, j, k)))
3589 # check a view is always returned, gh-5260
3590 assert_(not c.flags['OWNDATA'], str((i, j, k)))
3591 # check on non-contiguous input array
3592 if k == 1:
3593 b = c
3594
3595 def test_conjugate(self):
3596 a = np.array([1-1j, 1+1j, 23+23.0j])
3597 ac = a.conj()
3598 assert_equal(a.real, ac.real)
3599 assert_equal(a.imag, -ac.imag)
3600 assert_equal(ac, a.conjugate())
3601 assert_equal(ac, np.conjugate(a))
3602
3603 a = np.array([1-1j, 1+1j, 23+23.0j], 'F')
3604 ac = a.conj()
3605 assert_equal(a.real, ac.real)
3606 assert_equal(a.imag, -ac.imag)
3607 assert_equal(ac, a.conjugate())
3608 assert_equal(ac, np.conjugate(a))
3609
3610 a = np.array([1, 2, 3])
3611 ac = a.conj()
3612 assert_equal(a, ac)
3613 assert_equal(ac, a.conjugate())
3614 assert_equal(ac, np.conjugate(a))
3615
3616 a = np.array([1.0, 2.0, 3.0])
3617 ac = a.conj()
3618 assert_equal(a, ac)
3619 assert_equal(ac, a.conjugate())
3620 assert_equal(ac, np.conjugate(a))
3621
3622 a = np.array([1-1j, 1+1j, 1, 2.0], object)
3623 ac = a.conj()
3624 assert_equal(ac, [k.conjugate() for k in a])
3625 assert_equal(ac, a.conjugate())
3626 assert_equal(ac, np.conjugate(a))
3627
3628 a = np.array([1-1j, 1, 2.0, 'f'], object)
3629 assert_raises(TypeError, lambda: a.conj())
3630 assert_raises(TypeError, lambda: a.conjugate())
3631
3632 def test_conjugate_out(self):
3633 # Minimal test for the out argument being passed on correctly
3634 # NOTE: The ability to pass `out` is currently undocumented!
3635 a = np.array([1-1j, 1+1j, 23+23.0j])
3636 out = np.empty_like(a)
3637 res = a.conjugate(out)
3638 assert res is out
3639 assert_array_equal(out, a.conjugate())
3640
3641 def test__complex__(self):
3642 dtypes = ['i1', 'i2', 'i4', 'i8',
3643 'u1', 'u2', 'u4', 'u8',
3644 'f', 'd', 'g', 'F', 'D', 'G',
3645 '?', 'O']
3646 for dt in dtypes:
3647 a = np.array(7, dtype=dt)
3648 b = np.array([7], dtype=dt)
3649 c = np.array([[[[[7]]]]], dtype=dt)
3650
3651 msg = 'dtype: {0}'.format(dt)
3652 ap = complex(a)
3653 assert_equal(ap, a, msg)
3654
3655 with assert_warns(DeprecationWarning):
3656 bp = complex(b)
3657 assert_equal(bp, b, msg)
3658
3659 with assert_warns(DeprecationWarning):
3660 cp = complex(c)
3661 assert_equal(cp, c, msg)
3662
3663 def test__complex__should_not_work(self):
3664 dtypes = ['i1', 'i2', 'i4', 'i8',
3665 'u1', 'u2', 'u4', 'u8',
3666 'f', 'd', 'g', 'F', 'D', 'G',
3667 '?', 'O']
3668 for dt in dtypes:
3669 a = np.array([1, 2, 3], dtype=dt)
3670 assert_raises(TypeError, complex, a)
3671
3672 dt = np.dtype([('a', 'f8'), ('b', 'i1')])
3673 b = np.array((1.0, 3), dtype=dt)
3674 assert_raises(TypeError, complex, b)
3675
3676 c = np.array([(1.0, 3), (2e-3, 7)], dtype=dt)
3677 assert_raises(TypeError, complex, c)
3678
3679 d = np.array('1+1j')
3680 assert_raises(TypeError, complex, d)
3681
3682 e = np.array(['1+1j'], 'U')
3683 with assert_warns(DeprecationWarning):
3684 assert_raises(TypeError, complex, e)
3685
3686class TestCequenceMethods:
3687 def test_array_contains(self):
3688 assert_(4.0 in np.arange(16.).reshape(4,4))
3689 assert_(20.0 not in np.arange(16.).reshape(4,4))
3690
3691class TestBinop:
3692 def test_inplace(self):
3693 # test refcount 1 inplace conversion
3694 assert_array_almost_equal(np.array([0.5]) * np.array([1.0, 2.0]),
3695 [0.5, 1.0])
3696
3697 d = np.array([0.5, 0.5])[::2]
3698 assert_array_almost_equal(d * (d * np.array([1.0, 2.0])),
3699 [0.25, 0.5])
3700
3701 a = np.array([0.5])
3702 b = np.array([0.5])
3703 c = a + b
3704 c = a - b
3705 c = a * b
3706 c = a / b
3707 assert_equal(a, b)
3708 assert_almost_equal(c, 1.)
3709
3710 c = a + b * 2. / b * a - a / b
3711 assert_equal(a, b)
3712 assert_equal(c, 0.5)
3713
3714 # true divide
3715 a = np.array([5])
3716 b = np.array([3])
3717 c = (a * a) / b
3718
3719 assert_almost_equal(c, 25 / 3)
3720 assert_equal(a, 5)
3721 assert_equal(b, 3)
3722
3723 # ndarray.__rop__ always calls ufunc
3724 # ndarray.__iop__ always calls ufunc
3725 # ndarray.__op__, __rop__:
3726 # - defer if other has __array_ufunc__ and it is None
3727 # or other is not a subclass and has higher array priority
3728 # - else, call ufunc
3729 @pytest.mark.xfail(IS_PYPY, reason="Bug in pypy3.{9, 10}-v7.3.13, #24862")
3730 def test_ufunc_binop_interaction(self):
3731 # Python method name (without underscores)
3732 # -> (numpy ufunc, has_in_place_version, preferred_dtype)
3733 ops = {
3734 'add': (np.add, True, float),
3735 'sub': (np.subtract, True, float),
3736 'mul': (np.multiply, True, float),
3737 'truediv': (np.true_divide, True, float),
3738 'floordiv': (np.floor_divide, True, float),
3739 'mod': (np.remainder, True, float),
3740 'divmod': (np.divmod, False, float),
3741 'pow': (np.power, True, int),
3742 'lshift': (np.left_shift, True, int),
3743 'rshift': (np.right_shift, True, int),
3744 'and': (np.bitwise_and, True, int),
3745 'xor': (np.bitwise_xor, True, int),
3746 'or': (np.bitwise_or, True, int),
3747 'matmul': (np.matmul, True, float),
3748 # 'ge': (np.less_equal, False),
3749 # 'gt': (np.less, False),
3750 # 'le': (np.greater_equal, False),
3751 # 'lt': (np.greater, False),
3752 # 'eq': (np.equal, False),
3753 # 'ne': (np.not_equal, False),
3754 }
3755
3756 class Coerced(Exception):
3757 pass
3758
3759 def array_impl(self):
3760 raise Coerced
3761
3762 def op_impl(self, other):
3763 return "forward"
3764
3765 def rop_impl(self, other):
3766 return "reverse"
3767
3768 def iop_impl(self, other):
3769 return "in-place"
3770
3771 def array_ufunc_impl(self, ufunc, method, *args, **kwargs):
3772 return ("__array_ufunc__", ufunc, method, args, kwargs)
3773
3774 # Create an object with the given base, in the given module, with a
3775 # bunch of placeholder __op__ methods, and optionally a
3776 # __array_ufunc__ and __array_priority__.
3777 def make_obj(base, array_priority=False, array_ufunc=False,
3778 alleged_module="__main__"):
3779 class_namespace = {"__array__": array_impl}
3780 if array_priority is not False:
3781 class_namespace["__array_priority__"] = array_priority
3782 for op in ops:
3783 class_namespace["__{0}__".format(op)] = op_impl
3784 class_namespace["__r{0}__".format(op)] = rop_impl
3785 class_namespace["__i{0}__".format(op)] = iop_impl
3786 if array_ufunc is not False:
3787 class_namespace["__array_ufunc__"] = array_ufunc
3788 eval_namespace = {"base": base,
3789 "class_namespace": class_namespace,
3790 "__name__": alleged_module,
3791 }
3792 MyType = eval("type('MyType', (base,), class_namespace)",
3793 eval_namespace)
3794 if issubclass(MyType, np.ndarray):
3795 # Use this range to avoid special case weirdnesses around
3796 # divide-by-0, pow(x, 2), overflow due to pow(big, big), etc.
3797 return np.arange(3, 7).reshape(2, 2).view(MyType)
3798 else:
3799 return MyType()
3800
3801 def check(obj, binop_override_expected, ufunc_override_expected,
3802 inplace_override_expected, check_scalar=True):
3803 for op, (ufunc, has_inplace, dtype) in ops.items():
3804 err_msg = ('op: %s, ufunc: %s, has_inplace: %s, dtype: %s'
3805 % (op, ufunc, has_inplace, dtype))
3806 check_objs = [np.arange(3, 7, dtype=dtype).reshape(2, 2)]
3807 if check_scalar:
3808 check_objs.append(check_objs[0][0])
3809 for arr in check_objs:
3810 arr_method = getattr(arr, "__{0}__".format(op))
3811
3812 def first_out_arg(result):
3813 if op == "divmod":
3814 assert_(isinstance(result, tuple))
3815 return result[0]
3816 else:
3817 return result
3818
3819 # arr __op__ obj
3820 if binop_override_expected:
3821 assert_equal(arr_method(obj), NotImplemented, err_msg)
3822 elif ufunc_override_expected:
3823 assert_equal(arr_method(obj)[0], "__array_ufunc__",
3824 err_msg)
3825 else:
3826 if (isinstance(obj, np.ndarray) and
3827 (type(obj).__array_ufunc__ is
3828 np.ndarray.__array_ufunc__)):
3829 # __array__ gets ignored
3830 res = first_out_arg(arr_method(obj))
3831 assert_(res.__class__ is obj.__class__, err_msg)
3832 else:
3833 assert_raises((TypeError, Coerced),
3834 arr_method, obj, err_msg=err_msg)
3835 # obj __op__ arr
3836 arr_rmethod = getattr(arr, "__r{0}__".format(op))
3837 if ufunc_override_expected:
3838 res = arr_rmethod(obj)
3839 assert_equal(res[0], "__array_ufunc__",
3840 err_msg=err_msg)
3841 assert_equal(res[1], ufunc, err_msg=err_msg)
3842 else:
3843 if (isinstance(obj, np.ndarray) and
3844 (type(obj).__array_ufunc__ is
3845 np.ndarray.__array_ufunc__)):
3846 # __array__ gets ignored
3847 res = first_out_arg(arr_rmethod(obj))
3848 assert_(res.__class__ is obj.__class__, err_msg)
3849 else:
3850 # __array_ufunc__ = "asdf" creates a TypeError
3851 assert_raises((TypeError, Coerced),
3852 arr_rmethod, obj, err_msg=err_msg)
3853
3854 # arr __iop__ obj
3855 # array scalars don't have in-place operators
3856 if has_inplace and isinstance(arr, np.ndarray):
3857 arr_imethod = getattr(arr, "__i{0}__".format(op))
3858 if inplace_override_expected:
3859 assert_equal(arr_method(obj), NotImplemented,
3860 err_msg=err_msg)
3861 elif ufunc_override_expected:
3862 res = arr_imethod(obj)
3863 assert_equal(res[0], "__array_ufunc__", err_msg)
3864 assert_equal(res[1], ufunc, err_msg)
3865 assert_(type(res[-1]["out"]) is tuple, err_msg)
3866 assert_(res[-1]["out"][0] is arr, err_msg)
3867 else:
3868 if (isinstance(obj, np.ndarray) and
3869 (type(obj).__array_ufunc__ is
3870 np.ndarray.__array_ufunc__)):
3871 # __array__ gets ignored
3872 assert_(arr_imethod(obj) is arr, err_msg)
3873 else:
3874 assert_raises((TypeError, Coerced),
3875 arr_imethod, obj,
3876 err_msg=err_msg)
3877
3878 op_fn = getattr(operator, op, None)
3879 if op_fn is None:
3880 op_fn = getattr(operator, op + "_", None)
3881 if op_fn is None:
3882 op_fn = getattr(builtins, op)
3883 assert_equal(op_fn(obj, arr), "forward", err_msg)
3884 if not isinstance(obj, np.ndarray):
3885 if binop_override_expected:
3886 assert_equal(op_fn(arr, obj), "reverse", err_msg)
3887 elif ufunc_override_expected:
3888 assert_equal(op_fn(arr, obj)[0], "__array_ufunc__",
3889 err_msg)
3890 if ufunc_override_expected:
3891 assert_equal(ufunc(obj, arr)[0], "__array_ufunc__",
3892 err_msg)
3893
3894 # No array priority, no array_ufunc -> nothing called
3895 check(make_obj(object), False, False, False)
3896 # Negative array priority, no array_ufunc -> nothing called
3897 # (has to be very negative, because scalar priority is -1000000.0)
3898 check(make_obj(object, array_priority=-2**30), False, False, False)
3899 # Positive array priority, no array_ufunc -> binops and iops only
3900 check(make_obj(object, array_priority=1), True, False, True)
3901 # ndarray ignores array_priority for ndarray subclasses
3902 check(make_obj(np.ndarray, array_priority=1), False, False, False,
3903 check_scalar=False)
3904 # Positive array_priority and array_ufunc -> array_ufunc only
3905 check(make_obj(object, array_priority=1,
3906 array_ufunc=array_ufunc_impl), False, True, False)
3907 check(make_obj(np.ndarray, array_priority=1,
3908 array_ufunc=array_ufunc_impl), False, True, False)
3909 # array_ufunc set to None -> defer binops only
3910 check(make_obj(object, array_ufunc=None), True, False, False)
3911 check(make_obj(np.ndarray, array_ufunc=None), True, False, False,
3912 check_scalar=False)
3913
3914 @pytest.mark.parametrize("priority", [None, "runtime error"])
3915 def test_ufunc_binop_bad_array_priority(self, priority):
3916 # Mainly checks that this does not crash. The second array has a lower
3917 # priority than -1 ("error value"). If the __radd__ actually exists,
3918 # bad things can happen (I think via the scalar paths).
3919 # In principle both of these can probably just be errors in the future.
3920 class BadPriority:
3921 @property
3922 def __array_priority__(self):
3923 if priority == "runtime error":
3924 raise RuntimeError("RuntimeError in __array_priority__!")
3925 return priority
3926
3927 def __radd__(self, other):
3928 return "result"
3929
3930 class LowPriority(np.ndarray):
3931 __array_priority__ = -1000
3932
3933 # Priority failure uses the same as scalars (smaller -1000). So the
3934 # LowPriority wins with 'result' for each element (inner operation).
3935 res = np.arange(3).view(LowPriority) + BadPriority()
3936 assert res.shape == (3,)
3937 assert res[0] == 'result'
3938
3939
3940 def test_ufunc_override_normalize_signature(self):
3941 # gh-5674
3942 class SomeClass:
3943 def __array_ufunc__(self, ufunc, method, *inputs, **kw):
3944 return kw
3945
3946 a = SomeClass()
3947 kw = np.add(a, [1])
3948 assert_('sig' not in kw and 'signature' not in kw)
3949 kw = np.add(a, [1], sig='ii->i')
3950 assert_('sig' not in kw and 'signature' in kw)
3951 assert_equal(kw['signature'], 'ii->i')
3952 kw = np.add(a, [1], signature='ii->i')
3953 assert_('sig' not in kw and 'signature' in kw)
3954 assert_equal(kw['signature'], 'ii->i')
3955
3956 def test_array_ufunc_index(self):
3957 # Check that index is set appropriately, also if only an output
3958 # is passed on (latter is another regression tests for github bug 4753)
3959 # This also checks implicitly that 'out' is always a tuple.
3960 class CheckIndex:
3961 def __array_ufunc__(self, ufunc, method, *inputs, **kw):
3962 for i, a in enumerate(inputs):
3963 if a is self:
3964 return i
3965 # calls below mean we must be in an output.
3966 for j, a in enumerate(kw['out']):
3967 if a is self:
3968 return (j,)
3969
3970 a = CheckIndex()
3971 dummy = np.arange(2.)
3972 # 1 input, 1 output
3973 assert_equal(np.sin(a), 0)
3974 assert_equal(np.sin(dummy, a), (0,))
3975 assert_equal(np.sin(dummy, out=a), (0,))
3976 assert_equal(np.sin(dummy, out=(a,)), (0,))
3977 assert_equal(np.sin(a, a), 0)
3978 assert_equal(np.sin(a, out=a), 0)
3979 assert_equal(np.sin(a, out=(a,)), 0)
3980 # 1 input, 2 outputs
3981 assert_equal(np.modf(dummy, a), (0,))
3982 assert_equal(np.modf(dummy, None, a), (1,))
3983 assert_equal(np.modf(dummy, dummy, a), (1,))
3984 assert_equal(np.modf(dummy, out=(a, None)), (0,))
3985 assert_equal(np.modf(dummy, out=(a, dummy)), (0,))
3986 assert_equal(np.modf(dummy, out=(None, a)), (1,))
3987 assert_equal(np.modf(dummy, out=(dummy, a)), (1,))
3988 assert_equal(np.modf(a, out=(dummy, a)), 0)
3989 with assert_raises(TypeError):
3990 # Out argument must be tuple, since there are multiple outputs
3991 np.modf(dummy, out=a)
3992
3993 assert_raises(ValueError, np.modf, dummy, out=(a,))
3994
3995 # 2 inputs, 1 output
3996 assert_equal(np.add(a, dummy), 0)
3997 assert_equal(np.add(dummy, a), 1)
3998 assert_equal(np.add(dummy, dummy, a), (0,))
3999 assert_equal(np.add(dummy, a, a), 1)
4000 assert_equal(np.add(dummy, dummy, out=a), (0,))
4001 assert_equal(np.add(dummy, dummy, out=(a,)), (0,))
4002 assert_equal(np.add(a, dummy, out=a), 0)
4003
4004 def test_out_override(self):
4005 # regression test for github bug 4753
4006 class OutClass(np.ndarray):
4007 def __array_ufunc__(self, ufunc, method, *inputs, **kw):
4008 if 'out' in kw:
4009 tmp_kw = kw.copy()
4010 tmp_kw.pop('out')
4011 func = getattr(ufunc, method)
4012 kw['out'][0][...] = func(*inputs, **tmp_kw)
4013
4014 A = np.array([0]).view(OutClass)
4015 B = np.array([5])
4016 C = np.array([6])
4017 np.multiply(C, B, A)
4018 assert_equal(A[0], 30)
4019 assert_(isinstance(A, OutClass))
4020 A[0] = 0
4021 np.multiply(C, B, out=A)
4022 assert_equal(A[0], 30)
4023 assert_(isinstance(A, OutClass))
4024
4025 def test_pow_override_with_errors(self):
4026 # regression test for gh-9112
4027 class PowerOnly(np.ndarray):
4028 def __array_ufunc__(self, ufunc, method, *inputs, **kw):
4029 if ufunc is not np.power:
4030 raise NotImplementedError
4031 return "POWER!"
4032 # explicit cast to float, to ensure the fast power path is taken.
4033 a = np.array(5., dtype=np.float64).view(PowerOnly)
4034 assert_equal(a ** 2.5, "POWER!")
4035 with assert_raises(NotImplementedError):
4036 a ** 0.5
4037 with assert_raises(NotImplementedError):
4038 a ** 0
4039 with assert_raises(NotImplementedError):
4040 a ** 1
4041 with assert_raises(NotImplementedError):
4042 a ** -1
4043 with assert_raises(NotImplementedError):
4044 a ** 2
4045
4046 def test_pow_array_object_dtype(self):
4047 # test pow on arrays of object dtype
4048 class SomeClass:
4049 def __init__(self, num=None):
4050 self.num = num
4051
4052 # want to ensure a fast pow path is not taken
4053 def __mul__(self, other):
4054 raise AssertionError('__mul__ should not be called')
4055
4056 def __div__(self, other):
4057 raise AssertionError('__div__ should not be called')
4058
4059 def __pow__(self, exp):
4060 return SomeClass(num=self.num ** exp)
4061
4062 def __eq__(self, other):
4063 if isinstance(other, SomeClass):
4064 return self.num == other.num
4065
4066 __rpow__ = __pow__
4067
4068 def pow_for(exp, arr):
4069 return np.array([x ** exp for x in arr])
4070
4071 obj_arr = np.array([SomeClass(1), SomeClass(2), SomeClass(3)])
4072
4073 assert_equal(obj_arr ** 0.5, pow_for(0.5, obj_arr))
4074 assert_equal(obj_arr ** 0, pow_for(0, obj_arr))
4075 assert_equal(obj_arr ** 1, pow_for(1, obj_arr))
4076 assert_equal(obj_arr ** -1, pow_for(-1, obj_arr))
4077 assert_equal(obj_arr ** 2, pow_for(2, obj_arr))
4078
4079 def test_pos_array_ufunc_override(self):
4080 class A(np.ndarray):
4081 def __array_ufunc__(self, ufunc, method, *inputs, **kwargs):
4082 return getattr(ufunc, method)(*[i.view(np.ndarray) for
4083 i in inputs], **kwargs)
4084 tst = np.array('foo').view(A)
4085 with assert_raises(TypeError):
4086 +tst
4087
4088
4089class TestTemporaryElide:
4090 # elision is only triggered on relatively large arrays
4091
4092 def test_extension_incref_elide(self):
4093 # test extension (e.g. cython) calling PyNumber_* slots without
4094 # increasing the reference counts
4095 #
4096 # def incref_elide(a):
4097 # d = input.copy() # refcount 1
4098 # return d, d + d # PyNumber_Add without increasing refcount
4099 from numpy.core._multiarray_tests import incref_elide
4100 d = np.ones(100000)
4101 orig, res = incref_elide(d)
4102 d + d
4103 # the return original should not be changed to an inplace operation
4104 assert_array_equal(orig, d)
4105 assert_array_equal(res, d + d)
4106
4107 def test_extension_incref_elide_stack(self):
4108 # scanning if the refcount == 1 object is on the python stack to check
4109 # that we are called directly from python is flawed as object may still
4110 # be above the stack pointer and we have no access to the top of it
4111 #
4112 # def incref_elide_l(d):
4113 # return l[4] + l[4] # PyNumber_Add without increasing refcount
4114 from numpy.core._multiarray_tests import incref_elide_l
4115 # padding with 1 makes sure the object on the stack is not overwritten
4116 l = [1, 1, 1, 1, np.ones(100000)]
4117 res = incref_elide_l(l)
4118 # the return original should not be changed to an inplace operation
4119 assert_array_equal(l[4], np.ones(100000))
4120 assert_array_equal(res, l[4] + l[4])
4121
4122 def test_temporary_with_cast(self):
4123 # check that we don't elide into a temporary which would need casting
4124 d = np.ones(200000, dtype=np.int64)
4125 assert_equal(((d + d) + 2**222).dtype, np.dtype('O'))
4126
4127 r = ((d + d) / 2)
4128 assert_equal(r.dtype, np.dtype('f8'))
4129
4130 r = np.true_divide((d + d), 2)
4131 assert_equal(r.dtype, np.dtype('f8'))
4132
4133 r = ((d + d) / 2.)
4134 assert_equal(r.dtype, np.dtype('f8'))
4135
4136 r = ((d + d) // 2)
4137 assert_equal(r.dtype, np.dtype(np.int64))
4138
4139 # commutative elision into the astype result
4140 f = np.ones(100000, dtype=np.float32)
4141 assert_equal(((f + f) + f.astype(np.float64)).dtype, np.dtype('f8'))
4142
4143 # no elision into lower type
4144 d = f.astype(np.float64)
4145 assert_equal(((f + f) + d).dtype, d.dtype)
4146 l = np.ones(100000, dtype=np.longdouble)
4147 assert_equal(((d + d) + l).dtype, l.dtype)
4148
4149 # test unary abs with different output dtype
4150 for dt in (np.complex64, np.complex128, np.clongdouble):
4151 c = np.ones(100000, dtype=dt)
4152 r = abs(c * 2.0)
4153 assert_equal(r.dtype, np.dtype('f%d' % (c.itemsize // 2)))
4154
4155 def test_elide_broadcast(self):
4156 # test no elision on broadcast to higher dimension
4157 # only triggers elision code path in debug mode as triggering it in
4158 # normal mode needs 256kb large matching dimension, so a lot of memory
4159 d = np.ones((2000, 1), dtype=int)
4160 b = np.ones((2000), dtype=bool)
4161 r = (1 - d) + b
4162 assert_equal(r, 1)
4163 assert_equal(r.shape, (2000, 2000))
4164
4165 def test_elide_scalar(self):
4166 # check inplace op does not create ndarray from scalars
4167 a = np.bool_()
4168 assert_(type(~(a & a)) is np.bool_)
4169
4170 def test_elide_scalar_readonly(self):
4171 # The imaginary part of a real array is readonly. This needs to go
4172 # through fast_scalar_power which is only called for powers of
4173 # +1, -1, 0, 0.5, and 2, so use 2. Also need valid refcount for
4174 # elision which can be gotten for the imaginary part of a real
4175 # array. Should not error.
4176 a = np.empty(100000, dtype=np.float64)
4177 a.imag ** 2
4178
4179 def test_elide_readonly(self):
4180 # don't try to elide readonly temporaries
4181 r = np.asarray(np.broadcast_to(np.zeros(1), 100000).flat) * 0.0
4182 assert_equal(r, 0)
4183
4184 def test_elide_updateifcopy(self):
4185 a = np.ones(2**20)[::2]
4186 b = a.flat.__array__() + 1
4187 del b
4188 assert_equal(a, 1)
4189
4190
4191class TestCAPI:
4192 def test_IsPythonScalar(self):
4193 from numpy.core._multiarray_tests import IsPythonScalar
4194 assert_(IsPythonScalar(b'foobar'))
4195 assert_(IsPythonScalar(1))
4196 assert_(IsPythonScalar(2**80))
4197 assert_(IsPythonScalar(2.))
4198 assert_(IsPythonScalar("a"))
4199
4200 @pytest.mark.parametrize("converter",
4201 [_multiarray_tests.run_scalar_intp_converter,
4202 _multiarray_tests.run_scalar_intp_from_sequence])
4203 def test_intp_sequence_converters(self, converter):
4204 # Test simple values (-1 is special for error return paths)
4205 assert converter(10) == (10,)
4206 assert converter(-1) == (-1,)
4207 # A 0-D array looks a bit like a sequence but must take the integer
4208 # path:
4209 assert converter(np.array(123)) == (123,)
4210 # Test simple sequences (intp_from_sequence only supports length 1):
4211 assert converter((10,)) == (10,)
4212 assert converter(np.array([11])) == (11,)
4213
4214 @pytest.mark.parametrize("converter",
4215 [_multiarray_tests.run_scalar_intp_converter,
4216 _multiarray_tests.run_scalar_intp_from_sequence])
4217 @pytest.mark.skipif(IS_PYPY and sys.implementation.version <= (7, 3, 8),
4218 reason="PyPy bug in error formatting")
4219 def test_intp_sequence_converters_errors(self, converter):
4220 with pytest.raises(TypeError,
4221 match="expected a sequence of integers or a single integer, "):
4222 converter(object())
4223 with pytest.raises(TypeError,
4224 match="expected a sequence of integers or a single integer, "
4225 "got '32.0'"):
4226 converter(32.)
4227 with pytest.raises(TypeError,
4228 match="'float' object cannot be interpreted as an integer"):
4229 converter([32.])
4230 with pytest.raises(ValueError,
4231 match="Maximum allowed dimension"):
4232 # These converters currently convert overflows to a ValueError
4233 converter(2**64)
4234
4235
4236class TestSubscripting:
4237 def test_test_zero_rank(self):
4238 x = np.array([1, 2, 3])
4239 assert_(isinstance(x[0], np.int_))
4240 assert_(type(x[0, ...]) is np.ndarray)
4241
4242
4243class TestPickling:
4244 @pytest.mark.skipif(pickle.HIGHEST_PROTOCOL >= 5,
4245 reason=('this tests the error messages when trying to'
4246 'protocol 5 although it is not available'))
4247 def test_correct_protocol5_error_message(self):
4248 array = np.arange(10)
4249
4250 def test_record_array_with_object_dtype(self):
4251 my_object = object()
4252
4253 arr_with_object = np.array(
4254 [(my_object, 1, 2.0)],
4255 dtype=[('a', object), ('b', int), ('c', float)])
4256 arr_without_object = np.array(
4257 [('xxx', 1, 2.0)],
4258 dtype=[('a', str), ('b', int), ('c', float)])
4259
4260 for proto in range(2, pickle.HIGHEST_PROTOCOL + 1):
4261 depickled_arr_with_object = pickle.loads(
4262 pickle.dumps(arr_with_object, protocol=proto))
4263 depickled_arr_without_object = pickle.loads(
4264 pickle.dumps(arr_without_object, protocol=proto))
4265
4266 assert_equal(arr_with_object.dtype,
4267 depickled_arr_with_object.dtype)
4268 assert_equal(arr_without_object.dtype,
4269 depickled_arr_without_object.dtype)
4270
4271 @pytest.mark.skipif(pickle.HIGHEST_PROTOCOL < 5,
4272 reason="requires pickle protocol 5")
4273 def test_f_contiguous_array(self):
4274 f_contiguous_array = np.array([[1, 2, 3], [4, 5, 6]], order='F')
4275 buffers = []
4276
4277 # When using pickle protocol 5, Fortran-contiguous arrays can be
4278 # serialized using out-of-band buffers
4279 bytes_string = pickle.dumps(f_contiguous_array, protocol=5,
4280 buffer_callback=buffers.append)
4281
4282 assert len(buffers) > 0
4283
4284 depickled_f_contiguous_array = pickle.loads(bytes_string,
4285 buffers=buffers)
4286
4287 assert_equal(f_contiguous_array, depickled_f_contiguous_array)
4288
4289 def test_non_contiguous_array(self):
4290 non_contiguous_array = np.arange(12).reshape(3, 4)[:, :2]
4291 assert not non_contiguous_array.flags.c_contiguous
4292 assert not non_contiguous_array.flags.f_contiguous
4293
4294 # make sure non-contiguous arrays can be pickled-depickled
4295 # using any protocol
4296 for proto in range(2, pickle.HIGHEST_PROTOCOL + 1):
4297 depickled_non_contiguous_array = pickle.loads(
4298 pickle.dumps(non_contiguous_array, protocol=proto))
4299
4300 assert_equal(non_contiguous_array, depickled_non_contiguous_array)
4301
4302 def test_roundtrip(self):
4303 for proto in range(2, pickle.HIGHEST_PROTOCOL + 1):
4304 carray = np.array([[2, 9], [7, 0], [3, 8]])
4305 DATA = [
4306 carray,
4307 np.transpose(carray),
4308 np.array([('xxx', 1, 2.0)], dtype=[('a', (str, 3)), ('b', int),
4309 ('c', float)])
4310 ]
4311
4312 refs = [weakref.ref(a) for a in DATA]
4313 for a in DATA:
4314 assert_equal(
4315 a, pickle.loads(pickle.dumps(a, protocol=proto)),
4316 err_msg="%r" % a)
4317 del a, DATA, carray
4318 break_cycles()
4319 # check for reference leaks (gh-12793)
4320 for ref in refs:
4321 assert ref() is None
4322
4323 def _loads(self, obj):
4324 return pickle.loads(obj, encoding='latin1')
4325
4326 # version 0 pickles, using protocol=2 to pickle
4327 # version 0 doesn't have a version field
4328 def test_version0_int8(self):
4329 s = b'\x80\x02cnumpy.core._internal\n_reconstruct\nq\x01cnumpy\nndarray\nq\x02K\x00\x85U\x01b\x87Rq\x03(K\x04\x85cnumpy\ndtype\nq\x04U\x02i1K\x00K\x01\x87Rq\x05(U\x01|NNJ\xff\xff\xff\xffJ\xff\xff\xff\xfftb\x89U\x04\x01\x02\x03\x04tb.'
4330 a = np.array([1, 2, 3, 4], dtype=np.int8)
4331 p = self._loads(s)
4332 assert_equal(a, p)
4333
4334 def test_version0_float32(self):
4335 s = b'\x80\x02cnumpy.core._internal\n_reconstruct\nq\x01cnumpy\nndarray\nq\x02K\x00\x85U\x01b\x87Rq\x03(K\x04\x85cnumpy\ndtype\nq\x04U\x02f4K\x00K\x01\x87Rq\x05(U\x01<NNJ\xff\xff\xff\xffJ\xff\xff\xff\xfftb\x89U\x10\x00\x00\x80?\x00\x00\x00@\x00\x00@@\x00\x00\x80@tb.'
4336 a = np.array([1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0], dtype=np.float32)
4337 p = self._loads(s)
4338 assert_equal(a, p)
4339
4340 def test_version0_object(self):
4341 s = b'\x80\x02cnumpy.core._internal\n_reconstruct\nq\x01cnumpy\nndarray\nq\x02K\x00\x85U\x01b\x87Rq\x03(K\x02\x85cnumpy\ndtype\nq\x04U\x02O8K\x00K\x01\x87Rq\x05(U\x01|NNJ\xff\xff\xff\xffJ\xff\xff\xff\xfftb\x89]q\x06(}q\x07U\x01aK\x01s}q\x08U\x01bK\x02setb.'
4342 a = np.array([{'a': 1}, {'b': 2}])
4343 p = self._loads(s)
4344 assert_equal(a, p)
4345
4346 # version 1 pickles, using protocol=2 to pickle
4347 def test_version1_int8(self):
4348 s = b'\x80\x02cnumpy.core._internal\n_reconstruct\nq\x01cnumpy\nndarray\nq\x02K\x00\x85U\x01b\x87Rq\x03(K\x01K\x04\x85cnumpy\ndtype\nq\x04U\x02i1K\x00K\x01\x87Rq\x05(K\x01U\x01|NNJ\xff\xff\xff\xffJ\xff\xff\xff\xfftb\x89U\x04\x01\x02\x03\x04tb.'
4349 a = np.array([1, 2, 3, 4], dtype=np.int8)
4350 p = self._loads(s)
4351 assert_equal(a, p)
4352
4353 def test_version1_float32(self):
4354 s = b'\x80\x02cnumpy.core._internal\n_reconstruct\nq\x01cnumpy\nndarray\nq\x02K\x00\x85U\x01b\x87Rq\x03(K\x01K\x04\x85cnumpy\ndtype\nq\x04U\x02f4K\x00K\x01\x87Rq\x05(K\x01U\x01<NNJ\xff\xff\xff\xffJ\xff\xff\xff\xfftb\x89U\x10\x00\x00\x80?\x00\x00\x00@\x00\x00@@\x00\x00\x80@tb.'
4355 a = np.array([1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0], dtype=np.float32)
4356 p = self._loads(s)
4357 assert_equal(a, p)
4358
4359 def test_version1_object(self):
4360 s = b'\x80\x02cnumpy.core._internal\n_reconstruct\nq\x01cnumpy\nndarray\nq\x02K\x00\x85U\x01b\x87Rq\x03(K\x01K\x02\x85cnumpy\ndtype\nq\x04U\x02O8K\x00K\x01\x87Rq\x05(K\x01U\x01|NNJ\xff\xff\xff\xffJ\xff\xff\xff\xfftb\x89]q\x06(}q\x07U\x01aK\x01s}q\x08U\x01bK\x02setb.'
4361 a = np.array([{'a': 1}, {'b': 2}])
4362 p = self._loads(s)
4363 assert_equal(a, p)
4364
4365 def test_subarray_int_shape(self):
4366 s = b"cnumpy.core.multiarray\n_reconstruct\np0\n(cnumpy\nndarray\np1\n(I0\ntp2\nS'b'\np3\ntp4\nRp5\n(I1\n(I1\ntp6\ncnumpy\ndtype\np7\n(S'V6'\np8\nI0\nI1\ntp9\nRp10\n(I3\nS'|'\np11\nN(S'a'\np12\ng3\ntp13\n(dp14\ng12\n(g7\n(S'V4'\np15\nI0\nI1\ntp16\nRp17\n(I3\nS'|'\np18\n(g7\n(S'i1'\np19\nI0\nI1\ntp20\nRp21\n(I3\nS'|'\np22\nNNNI-1\nI-1\nI0\ntp23\nb(I2\nI2\ntp24\ntp25\nNNI4\nI1\nI0\ntp26\nbI0\ntp27\nsg3\n(g7\n(S'V2'\np28\nI0\nI1\ntp29\nRp30\n(I3\nS'|'\np31\n(g21\nI2\ntp32\nNNI2\nI1\nI0\ntp33\nbI4\ntp34\nsI6\nI1\nI0\ntp35\nbI00\nS'\\x01\\x01\\x01\\x01\\x01\\x02'\np36\ntp37\nb."
4367 a = np.array([(1, (1, 2))], dtype=[('a', 'i1', (2, 2)), ('b', 'i1', 2)])
4368 p = self._loads(s)
4369 assert_equal(a, p)
4370
4371 def test_datetime64_byteorder(self):
4372 original = np.array([['2015-02-24T00:00:00.000000000']], dtype='datetime64[ns]')
4373
4374 original_byte_reversed = original.copy(order='K')
4375 original_byte_reversed.dtype = original_byte_reversed.dtype.newbyteorder('S')
4376 original_byte_reversed.byteswap(inplace=True)
4377
4378 new = pickle.loads(pickle.dumps(original_byte_reversed))
4379
4380 assert_equal(original.dtype, new.dtype)
4381
4382
4383class TestFancyIndexing:
4384 def test_list(self):
4385 x = np.ones((1, 1))
4386 x[:, [0]] = 2.0
4387 assert_array_equal(x, np.array([[2.0]]))
4388
4389 x = np.ones((1, 1, 1))
4390 x[:, :, [0]] = 2.0
4391 assert_array_equal(x, np.array([[[2.0]]]))
4392
4393 def test_tuple(self):
4394 x = np.ones((1, 1))
4395 x[:, (0,)] = 2.0
4396 assert_array_equal(x, np.array([[2.0]]))
4397 x = np.ones((1, 1, 1))
4398 x[:, :, (0,)] = 2.0
4399 assert_array_equal(x, np.array([[[2.0]]]))
4400
4401 def test_mask(self):
4402 x = np.array([1, 2, 3, 4])
4403 m = np.array([0, 1, 0, 0], bool)
4404 assert_array_equal(x[m], np.array([2]))
4405
4406 def test_mask2(self):
4407 x = np.array([[1, 2, 3, 4], [5, 6, 7, 8]])
4408 m = np.array([0, 1], bool)
4409 m2 = np.array([[0, 1, 0, 0], [1, 0, 0, 0]], bool)
4410 m3 = np.array([[0, 1, 0, 0], [0, 0, 0, 0]], bool)
4411 assert_array_equal(x[m], np.array([[5, 6, 7, 8]]))
4412 assert_array_equal(x[m2], np.array([2, 5]))
4413 assert_array_equal(x[m3], np.array([2]))
4414
4415 def test_assign_mask(self):
4416 x = np.array([1, 2, 3, 4])
4417 m = np.array([0, 1, 0, 0], bool)
4418 x[m] = 5
4419 assert_array_equal(x, np.array([1, 5, 3, 4]))
4420
4421 def test_assign_mask2(self):
4422 xorig = np.array([[1, 2, 3, 4], [5, 6, 7, 8]])
4423 m = np.array([0, 1], bool)
4424 m2 = np.array([[0, 1, 0, 0], [1, 0, 0, 0]], bool)
4425 m3 = np.array([[0, 1, 0, 0], [0, 0, 0, 0]], bool)
4426 x = xorig.copy()
4427 x[m] = 10
4428 assert_array_equal(x, np.array([[1, 2, 3, 4], [10, 10, 10, 10]]))
4429 x = xorig.copy()
4430 x[m2] = 10
4431 assert_array_equal(x, np.array([[1, 10, 3, 4], [10, 6, 7, 8]]))
4432 x = xorig.copy()
4433 x[m3] = 10
4434 assert_array_equal(x, np.array([[1, 10, 3, 4], [5, 6, 7, 8]]))
4435
4436
4437class TestStringCompare:
4438 def test_string(self):
4439 g1 = np.array(["This", "is", "example"])
4440 g2 = np.array(["This", "was", "example"])
4441 assert_array_equal(g1 == g2, [g1[i] == g2[i] for i in [0, 1, 2]])
4442 assert_array_equal(g1 != g2, [g1[i] != g2[i] for i in [0, 1, 2]])
4443 assert_array_equal(g1 <= g2, [g1[i] <= g2[i] for i in [0, 1, 2]])
4444 assert_array_equal(g1 >= g2, [g1[i] >= g2[i] for i in [0, 1, 2]])
4445 assert_array_equal(g1 < g2, [g1[i] < g2[i] for i in [0, 1, 2]])
4446 assert_array_equal(g1 > g2, [g1[i] > g2[i] for i in [0, 1, 2]])
4447
4448 def test_mixed(self):
4449 g1 = np.array(["spam", "spa", "spammer", "and eggs"])
4450 g2 = "spam"
4451 assert_array_equal(g1 == g2, [x == g2 for x in g1])
4452 assert_array_equal(g1 != g2, [x != g2 for x in g1])
4453 assert_array_equal(g1 < g2, [x < g2 for x in g1])
4454 assert_array_equal(g1 > g2, [x > g2 for x in g1])
4455 assert_array_equal(g1 <= g2, [x <= g2 for x in g1])
4456 assert_array_equal(g1 >= g2, [x >= g2 for x in g1])
4457
4458 def test_unicode(self):
4459 g1 = np.array(["This", "is", "example"])
4460 g2 = np.array(["This", "was", "example"])
4461 assert_array_equal(g1 == g2, [g1[i] == g2[i] for i in [0, 1, 2]])
4462 assert_array_equal(g1 != g2, [g1[i] != g2[i] for i in [0, 1, 2]])
4463 assert_array_equal(g1 <= g2, [g1[i] <= g2[i] for i in [0, 1, 2]])
4464 assert_array_equal(g1 >= g2, [g1[i] >= g2[i] for i in [0, 1, 2]])
4465 assert_array_equal(g1 < g2, [g1[i] < g2[i] for i in [0, 1, 2]])
4466 assert_array_equal(g1 > g2, [g1[i] > g2[i] for i in [0, 1, 2]])
4467
4468class TestArgmaxArgminCommon:
4469
4470 sizes = [(), (3,), (3, 2), (2, 3),
4471 (3, 3), (2, 3, 4), (4, 3, 2),
4472 (1, 2, 3, 4), (2, 3, 4, 1),
4473 (3, 4, 1, 2), (4, 1, 2, 3),
4474 (64,), (128,), (256,)]
4475
4476 @pytest.mark.parametrize("size, axis", itertools.chain(*[[(size, axis)
4477 for axis in list(range(-len(size), len(size))) + [None]]
4478 for size in sizes]))
4479 @pytest.mark.parametrize('method', [np.argmax, np.argmin])
4480 def test_np_argmin_argmax_keepdims(self, size, axis, method):
4481
4482 arr = np.random.normal(size=size)
4483
4484 # contiguous arrays
4485 if axis is None:
4486 new_shape = [1 for _ in range(len(size))]
4487 else:
4488 new_shape = list(size)
4489 new_shape[axis] = 1
4490 new_shape = tuple(new_shape)
4491
4492 _res_orig = method(arr, axis=axis)
4493 res_orig = _res_orig.reshape(new_shape)
4494 res = method(arr, axis=axis, keepdims=True)
4495 assert_equal(res, res_orig)
4496 assert_(res.shape == new_shape)
4497 outarray = np.empty(res.shape, dtype=res.dtype)
4498 res1 = method(arr, axis=axis, out=outarray,
4499 keepdims=True)
4500 assert_(res1 is outarray)
4501 assert_equal(res, outarray)
4502
4503 if len(size) > 0:
4504 wrong_shape = list(new_shape)
4505 if axis is not None:
4506 wrong_shape[axis] = 2
4507 else:
4508 wrong_shape[0] = 2
4509 wrong_outarray = np.empty(wrong_shape, dtype=res.dtype)
4510 with pytest.raises(ValueError):
4511 method(arr.T, axis=axis,
4512 out=wrong_outarray, keepdims=True)
4513
4514 # non-contiguous arrays
4515 if axis is None:
4516 new_shape = [1 for _ in range(len(size))]
4517 else:
4518 new_shape = list(size)[::-1]
4519 new_shape[axis] = 1
4520 new_shape = tuple(new_shape)
4521
4522 _res_orig = method(arr.T, axis=axis)
4523 res_orig = _res_orig.reshape(new_shape)
4524 res = method(arr.T, axis=axis, keepdims=True)
4525 assert_equal(res, res_orig)
4526 assert_(res.shape == new_shape)
4527 outarray = np.empty(new_shape[::-1], dtype=res.dtype)
4528 outarray = outarray.T
4529 res1 = method(arr.T, axis=axis, out=outarray,
4530 keepdims=True)
4531 assert_(res1 is outarray)
4532 assert_equal(res, outarray)
4533
4534 if len(size) > 0:
4535 # one dimension lesser for non-zero sized
