9186class TestFormat:
9187
9188 def test_0d(self):
9189 a = np.array(np.pi)
9190 assert_equal('{:0.3g}'.format(a), '3.14')
9191 assert_equal('{:0.3g}'.format(a[()]), '3.14')
9192
9193 def test_1d_no_format(self):
9194 a = np.array([np.pi])
9195 assert_equal('{}'.format(a), str(a))
9196
9197 def test_1d_format(self):
9198 # until gh-5543, ensure that the behaviour matches what it used to be
9199 a = np.array([np.pi])
9200 assert_raises(TypeError, '{:30}'.format, a)
9201
9202from numpy.testing import IS_PYPY
9203
9204class TestCTypes:
9205
9206 def test_ctypes_is_available(self):
9207 test_arr = np.array([[1, 2, 3], [4, 5, 6]])
9208
9209 assert_equal(ctypes, test_arr.ctypes._ctypes)
9210 assert_equal(tuple(test_arr.ctypes.shape), (2, 3))
9211
9212 def test_ctypes_is_not_available(self):
9213 from numpy.core import _internal
9214 _internal.ctypes = None
9215 try:
9216 test_arr = np.array([[1, 2, 3], [4, 5, 6]])
9217
9218 assert_(isinstance(test_arr.ctypes._ctypes,
9219 _internal._missing_ctypes))
9220 assert_equal(tuple(test_arr.ctypes.shape), (2, 3))
9221 finally:
9222 _internal.ctypes = ctypes
9223
9224 def _make_readonly(x):
9225 x.flags.writeable = False
9226 return x
9227
9228 @pytest.mark.parametrize('arr', [
9229 np.array([1, 2, 3]),
9230 np.array([['one', 'two'], ['three', 'four']]),
9231 np.array((1, 2), dtype='i4,i4'),
9232 np.zeros((2,), dtype=
9233 np.dtype(dict(
9234 formats=['<i4', '<i4'],
9235 names=['a', 'b'],
9236 offsets=[0, 2],
9237 itemsize=6
9238 ))
9239 ),
9240 np.array([None], dtype=object),
9241 np.array([]),
9242 np.empty((0, 0)),
9243 _make_readonly(np.array([1, 2, 3])),
9244 ], ids=[
9245 '1d',
9246 '2d',
9247 'structured',
9248 'overlapping',
9249 'object',
9250 'empty',
9251 'empty-2d',
9252 'readonly'
9253 ])
9254 def test_ctypes_data_as_holds_reference(self, arr):
9255 # gh-9647
9256 # create a copy to ensure that pytest does not mess with the refcounts
9257 arr = arr.copy()
9258
9259 arr_ref = weakref.ref(arr)
9260
9261 ctypes_ptr = arr.ctypes.data_as(ctypes.c_void_p)
9262
9263 # `ctypes_ptr` should hold onto `arr`
9264 del arr
9265 break_cycles()
9266 assert_(arr_ref() is not None, "ctypes pointer did not hold onto a reference")
9267
9268 # but when the `ctypes_ptr` object dies, so should `arr`
9269 del ctypes_ptr
9270 if IS_PYPY:
9271 # Pypy does not recycle arr objects immediately. Trigger gc to
9272 # release arr. Cpython uses refcounts. An explicit call to gc
9273 # should not be needed here.
9274 break_cycles()
9275 assert_(arr_ref() is None, "unknowable whether ctypes pointer holds a reference")
9276
9277 def test_ctypes_as_parameter_holds_reference(self):
9278 arr = np.array([None]).copy()
9279
9280 arr_ref = weakref.ref(arr)
9281
9282 ctypes_ptr = arr.ctypes._as_parameter_
9283
9284 # `ctypes_ptr` should hold onto `arr`
9285 del arr
9286 break_cycles()
9287 assert_(arr_ref() is not None, "ctypes pointer did not hold onto a reference")
9288
9289 # but when the `ctypes_ptr` object dies, so should `arr`
9290 del ctypes_ptr
9291 if IS_PYPY:
9292 break_cycles()
9293 assert_(arr_ref() is None, "unknowable whether ctypes pointer holds a reference")
9294
9295
9296class TestWritebackIfCopy:
9297 # all these tests use the WRITEBACKIFCOPY mechanism
9298 def test_argmax_with_out(self):
9299 mat = np.eye(5)
9300 out = np.empty(5, dtype='i2')
9301 res = np.argmax(mat, 0, out=out)
9302 assert_equal(res, range(5))
9303
9304 def test_argmin_with_out(self):
9305 mat = -np.eye(5)
9306 out = np.empty(5, dtype='i2')
9307 res = np.argmin(mat, 0, out=out)
9308 assert_equal(res, range(5))
9309
9310 def test_insert_noncontiguous(self):
9311 a = np.arange(6).reshape(2,3).T # force non-c-contiguous
9312 # uses arr_insert
9313 np.place(a, a>2, [44, 55])
9314 assert_equal(a, np.array([[0, 44], [1, 55], [2, 44]]))
9315 # hit one of the failing paths
9316 assert_raises(ValueError, np.place, a, a>20, [])
9317
9318 def test_put_noncontiguous(self):
9319 a = np.arange(6).reshape(2,3).T # force non-c-contiguous
9320 np.put(a, [0, 2], [44, 55])
9321 assert_equal(a, np.array([[44, 3], [55, 4], [2, 5]]))
9322
9323 def test_putmask_noncontiguous(self):
9324 a = np.arange(6).reshape(2,3).T # force non-c-contiguous
9325 # uses arr_putmask
9326 np.putmask(a, a>2, a**2)
9327 assert_equal(a, np.array([[0, 9], [1, 16], [2, 25]]))
9328
9329 def test_take_mode_raise(self):
9330 a = np.arange(6, dtype='int')
9331 out = np.empty(2, dtype='int')
9332 np.take(a, [0, 2], out=out, mode='raise')
9333 assert_equal(out, np.array([0, 2]))
9334
9335 def test_choose_mod_raise(self):
9336 a = np.array([[1, 0, 1], [0, 1, 0], [1, 0, 1]])
9337 out = np.empty((3,3), dtype='int')
9338 choices = [-10, 10]
9339 np.choose(a, choices, out=out, mode='raise')
9340 assert_equal(out, np.array([[ 10, -10, 10],
9341 [-10, 10, -10],
9342 [ 10, -10, 10]]))
9343
9344 def test_flatiter__array__(self):
9345 a = np.arange(9).reshape(3,3)
9346 b = a.T.flat
9347 c = b.__array__()
9348 # triggers the WRITEBACKIFCOPY resolution, assuming refcount semantics
9349 del c
9350
9351 def test_dot_out(self):
9352 # if HAVE_CBLAS, will use WRITEBACKIFCOPY
9353 a = np.arange(9, dtype=float).reshape(3,3)
9354 b = np.dot(a, a, out=a)
9355 assert_equal(b, np.array([[15, 18, 21], [42, 54, 66], [69, 90, 111]]))
9356
9357 def test_view_assign(self):
9358 from numpy.core._multiarray_tests import npy_create_writebackifcopy, npy_resolve
9359
9360 arr = np.arange(9).reshape(3, 3).T
9361 arr_wb = npy_create_writebackifcopy(arr)
9362 assert_(arr_wb.flags.writebackifcopy)
9363 assert_(arr_wb.base is arr)
9364 arr_wb[...] = -100
9365 npy_resolve(arr_wb)
9366 # arr changes after resolve, even though we assigned to arr_wb
9367 assert_equal(arr, -100)
9368 # after resolve, the two arrays no longer reference each other
9369 assert_(arr_wb.ctypes.data != 0)
9370 assert_equal(arr_wb.base, None)
9371 # assigning to arr_wb does not get transferred to arr
9372 arr_wb[...] = 100
9373 assert_equal(arr, -100)
9374
9375 @pytest.mark.leaks_references(
9376 reason="increments self in dealloc; ignore since deprecated path.")
9377 def test_dealloc_warning(self):
9378 with suppress_warnings() as sup:
9379 sup.record(RuntimeWarning)
9380 arr = np.arange(9).reshape(3, 3)
9381 v = arr.T
9382 _multiarray_tests.npy_abuse_writebackifcopy(v)
9383 assert len(sup.log) == 1
9384
9385 def test_view_discard_refcount(self):
9386 from numpy.core._multiarray_tests import npy_create_writebackifcopy, npy_discard
9387
9388 arr = np.arange(9).reshape(3, 3).T
9389 orig = arr.copy()
9390 if HAS_REFCOUNT:
9391 arr_cnt = sys.getrefcount(arr)
9392 arr_wb = npy_create_writebackifcopy(arr)
9393 assert_(arr_wb.flags.writebackifcopy)
9394 assert_(arr_wb.base is arr)
9395 arr_wb[...] = -100
9396 npy_discard(arr_wb)
9397 # arr remains unchanged after discard
9398 assert_equal(arr, orig)
9399 # after discard, the two arrays no longer reference each other
9400 assert_(arr_wb.ctypes.data != 0)
9401 assert_equal(arr_wb.base, None)
9402 if HAS_REFCOUNT:
9403 assert_equal(arr_cnt, sys.getrefcount(arr))
9404 # assigning to arr_wb does not get transferred to arr
9405 arr_wb[...] = 100
9406 assert_equal(arr, orig)
9407
9408
9409class TestArange:
9410 def test_infinite(self):
9411 assert_raises_regex(
9412 ValueError, "size exceeded",
9413 np.arange, 0, np.inf
9414 )
9415
9416 def test_nan_step(self):
9417 assert_raises_regex(
9418 ValueError, "cannot compute length",
9419 np.arange, 0, 1, np.nan
9420 )
9421
9422 def test_zero_step(self):
9423 assert_raises(ZeroDivisionError, np.arange, 0, 10, 0)
9424 assert_raises(ZeroDivisionError, np.arange, 0.0, 10.0, 0.0)
9425
9426 # empty range
9427 assert_raises(ZeroDivisionError, np.arange, 0, 0, 0)
9428 assert_raises(ZeroDivisionError, np.arange, 0.0, 0.0, 0.0)
9429
9430 def test_require_range(self):
9431 assert_raises(TypeError, np.arange)
9432 assert_raises(TypeError, np.arange, step=3)
9433 assert_raises(TypeError, np.arange, dtype='int64')
9434 assert_raises(TypeError, np.arange, start=4)
9435
9436 def test_start_stop_kwarg(self):
9437 keyword_stop = np.arange(stop=3)
9438 keyword_zerotostop = np.arange(start=0, stop=3)
9439 keyword_start_stop = np.arange(start=3, stop=9)
9440
9441 assert len(keyword_stop) == 3
9442 assert len(keyword_zerotostop) == 3
9443 assert len(keyword_start_stop) == 6
9444 assert_array_equal(keyword_stop, keyword_zerotostop)
9445
9446 def test_arange_booleans(self):
9447 # Arange makes some sense for booleans and works up to length 2.
9448 # But it is weird since `arange(2, 4, dtype=bool)` works.
9449 # Arguably, much or all of this could be deprecated/removed.
9450 res = np.arange(False, dtype=bool)
9451 assert_array_equal(res, np.array([], dtype="bool"))
9452
9453 res = np.arange(True, dtype="bool")
9454 assert_array_equal(res, [False])
9455
9456 res = np.arange(2, dtype="bool")
9457 assert_array_equal(res, [False, True])
9458
9459 # This case is especially weird, but drops out without special case:
9460 res = np.arange(6, 8, dtype="bool")
9461 assert_array_equal(res, [True, True])
9462
9463 with pytest.raises(TypeError):
9464 np.arange(3, dtype="bool")
9465
9466 @pytest.mark.parametrize("dtype", ["S3", "U", "5i"])
9467 def test_rejects_bad_dtypes(self, dtype):
9468 dtype = np.dtype(dtype)
9469 DType_name = re.escape(str(type(dtype)))
9470 with pytest.raises(TypeError,
9471 match=rf"arange\‍(\‍) not supported for inputs .* {DType_name}"):
9472 np.arange(2, dtype=dtype)
9473
9474 def test_rejects_strings(self):
9475 # Explicitly test error for strings which may call "b" - "a":
9476 DType_name = re.escape(str(type(np.array("a").dtype)))
9477 with pytest.raises(TypeError,
9478 match=rf"arange\‍(\‍) not supported for inputs .* {DType_name}"):
9479 np.arange("a", "b")
9480
9481 def test_byteswapped(self):
9482 res_be = np.arange(1, 1000, dtype=">i4")
9483 res_le = np.arange(1, 1000, dtype="<i4")
9484 assert res_be.dtype == ">i4"
9485 assert res_le.dtype == "<i4"
9486 assert_array_equal(res_le, res_be)
9487
9488 @pytest.mark.parametrize("which", [0, 1, 2])
9489 def test_error_paths_and_promotion(self, which):
9490 args = [0, 1, 2] # start, stop, and step
9491 args[which] = np.float64(2.) # should ensure float64 output
9492
9493 assert np.arange(*args).dtype == np.float64
9494
9495 # Cover stranger error path, test only to achieve code coverage!
9496 args[which] = [None, []]
9497 with pytest.raises(ValueError):
9498 # Fails discovering start dtype
9499 np.arange(*args)
9500
9501
9502class TestArrayFinalize:
9503 """ Tests __array_finalize__ """
9504
9505 def test_receives_base(self):
9506 # gh-11237
9507 class SavesBase(np.ndarray):
9508 def __array_finalize__(self, obj):
9509 self.saved_base = self.base
9510
9511 a = np.array(1).view(SavesBase)
9512 assert_(a.saved_base is a.base)
9513
9514 def test_bad_finalize1(self):
9515 class BadAttributeArray(np.ndarray):
9516 @property
9517 def __array_finalize__(self):
9518 raise RuntimeError("boohoo!")
9519
9520 with pytest.raises(TypeError, match="not callable"):
9521 np.arange(10).view(BadAttributeArray)
9522
9523 def test_bad_finalize2(self):
9524 class BadAttributeArray(np.ndarray):
9525 def __array_finalize__(self):
9526 raise RuntimeError("boohoo!")
9527
9528 with pytest.raises(TypeError, match="takes 1 positional"):
9529 np.arange(10).view(BadAttributeArray)
9530
9531 def test_bad_finalize3(self):
9532 class BadAttributeArray(np.ndarray):
9533 def __array_finalize__(self, obj):
9534 raise RuntimeError("boohoo!")
9535
9536 with pytest.raises(RuntimeError, match="boohoo!"):
9537 np.arange(10).view(BadAttributeArray)
9538
9539 def test_lifetime_on_error(self):
9540 # gh-11237
9541 class RaisesInFinalize(np.ndarray):
9542 def __array_finalize__(self, obj):
9543 # crash, but keep this object alive
9544 raise Exception(self)
9545
9546 # a plain object can't be weakref'd
9547 class Dummy: pass
9548
9549 # get a weak reference to an object within an array
9550 obj_arr = np.array(Dummy())
9551 obj_ref = weakref.ref(obj_arr[()])
9552
9553 # get an array that crashed in __array_finalize__
9554 with assert_raises(Exception) as e:
9555 obj_arr.view(RaisesInFinalize)
9556
9557 obj_subarray = e.exception.args[0]
9558 del e
9559 assert_(isinstance(obj_subarray, RaisesInFinalize))
9560
9561 # reference should still be held by obj_arr
9562 break_cycles()
9563 assert_(obj_ref() is not None, "object should not already be dead")
9564
9565 del obj_arr
9566 break_cycles()
9567 assert_(obj_ref() is not None, "obj_arr should not hold the last reference")
9568
9569 del obj_subarray
9570 break_cycles()
9571 assert_(obj_ref() is None, "no references should remain")
9572
9573 def test_can_use_super(self):
9574 class SuperFinalize(np.ndarray):
9575 def __array_finalize__(self, obj):
9576 self.saved_result = super().__array_finalize__(obj)
9577
9578 a = np.array(1).view(SuperFinalize)
9579 assert_(a.saved_result is None)
9580
9581
9582def test_orderconverter_with_nonASCII_unicode_ordering():
9583 # gh-7475
9584 a = np.arange(5)
9585 assert_raises(ValueError, a.flatten, order='\xe2')
9586
9587
9588def test_equal_override():
9589 # gh-9153: ndarray.__eq__ uses special logic for structured arrays, which
9590 # did not respect overrides with __array_priority__ or __array_ufunc__.
9591 # The PR fixed this for __array_priority__ and __array_ufunc__ = None.
9592 class MyAlwaysEqual:
9593 def __eq__(self, other):
9594 return "eq"
9595
9596 def __ne__(self, other):
9597 return "ne"
9598
9599 class MyAlwaysEqualOld(MyAlwaysEqual):
9600 __array_priority__ = 10000
9601
9602 class MyAlwaysEqualNew(MyAlwaysEqual):
9603 __array_ufunc__ = None
9604
9605 array = np.array([(0, 1), (2, 3)], dtype='i4,i4')
9606 for my_always_equal_cls in MyAlwaysEqualOld, MyAlwaysEqualNew:
9607 my_always_equal = my_always_equal_cls()
9608 assert_equal(my_always_equal == array, 'eq')
9609 assert_equal(array == my_always_equal, 'eq')
9610 assert_equal(my_always_equal != array, 'ne')
9611 assert_equal(array != my_always_equal, 'ne')
9612
9613
9614@pytest.mark.parametrize("op", [operator.eq, operator.ne])
9615@pytest.mark.parametrize(["dt1", "dt2"], [
9616 ([("f", "i")], [("f", "i")]), # structured comparison (successful)
9617 ("M8", "d"), # impossible comparison: result is all True or False
9618 ("d", "d"), # valid comparison
9619 ])
9620def test_equal_subclass_no_override(op, dt1, dt2):
9621 # Test how the three different possible code-paths deal with subclasses
9622
9623 class MyArr(np.ndarray):
9624 called_wrap = 0
9625
9626 def __array_wrap__(self, new):
9627 type(self).called_wrap += 1
9628 return super().__array_wrap__(new)
9629
9630 numpy_arr = np.zeros(5, dtype=dt1)
9631 my_arr = np.zeros(5, dtype=dt2).view(MyArr)
9632
9633 assert type(op(numpy_arr, my_arr)) is MyArr
9634 assert type(op(my_arr, numpy_arr)) is MyArr
9635 # We expect 2 calls (more if there were more fields):
9636 assert MyArr.called_wrap == 2
9637
9638
9639@pytest.mark.parametrize(["dt1", "dt2"], [
9640 ("M8[ns]", "d"),
9641 ("M8[s]", "l"),
9642 ("m8[ns]", "d"),
9643 # Missing: ("m8[ns]", "l") as timedelta currently promotes ints
9644 ("M8[s]", "m8[s]"),
9645 ("S5", "U5"),
9646 # Structured/void dtypes have explicit paths not tested here.
9647])
9648def test_no_loop_gives_all_true_or_false(dt1, dt2):
9649 # Make sure they broadcast to test result shape, use random values, since
9650 # the actual value should be ignored
9651 arr1 = np.random.randint(5, size=100).astype(dt1)
9652 arr2 = np.random.randint(5, size=99)[:, np.newaxis].astype(dt2)
9653
9654 res = arr1 == arr2
9655 assert res.shape == (99, 100)
9656 assert res.dtype == bool
9657 assert not res.any()
9658
9659 res = arr1 != arr2
9660 assert res.shape == (99, 100)
9661 assert res.dtype == bool
9662 assert res.all()
9663
9664 # incompatible shapes raise though
9665 arr2 = np.random.randint(5, size=99).astype(dt2)
9666 with pytest.raises(ValueError):
9667 arr1 == arr2
9668
9669 with pytest.raises(ValueError):
9670 arr1 != arr2
9671
9672 # Basic test with another operation:
9673 with pytest.raises(np.core._exceptions._UFuncNoLoopError):
9674 arr1 > arr2
9675
9676
9677@pytest.mark.parametrize("op", [
9678 operator.eq, operator.ne, operator.le, operator.lt, operator.ge,
9679 operator.gt])
9680def test_comparisons_forwards_error(op):
9681 class NotArray:
9682 def __array__(self):
9683 raise TypeError("run you fools")
9684
9685 with pytest.raises(TypeError, match="run you fools"):
9686 op(np.arange(2), NotArray())
9687
9688 with pytest.raises(TypeError, match="run you fools"):
9689 op(NotArray(), np.arange(2))
9690
9691
9692def test_richcompare_scalar_boolean_singleton_return():
9693 # These are currently guaranteed to be the boolean singletons, but maybe
9694 # returning NumPy booleans would also be OK:
9695 assert (np.array(0) == "a") is False
9696 assert (np.array(0) != "a") is True
9697 assert (np.int16(0) == "a") is False
9698 assert (np.int16(0) != "a") is True
9699
9700
9701@pytest.mark.parametrize("op", [
9702 operator.eq, operator.ne, operator.le, operator.lt, operator.ge,
9703 operator.gt])
9704def test_ragged_comparison_fails(op):
9705 # This needs to convert the internal array to True/False, which fails:
9706 a = np.array([1, np.array([1, 2, 3])], dtype=object)
9707 b = np.array([1, np.array([1, 2, 3])], dtype=object)
9708
9709 with pytest.raises(ValueError, match="The truth value.*ambiguous"):
9710 op(a, b)
9711
9712
9713@pytest.mark.parametrize(
9714 ["fun", "npfun"],
9715 [
9716 (_multiarray_tests.npy_cabs, np.absolute),
9717 (_multiarray_tests.npy_carg, np.angle)
9718 ]
9719)
9720@pytest.mark.parametrize("x", [1, np.inf, -np.inf, np.nan])
9721@pytest.mark.parametrize("y", [1, np.inf, -np.inf, np.nan])
9722@pytest.mark.parametrize("test_dtype", np.complexfloating.__subclasses__())
9723def test_npymath_complex(fun, npfun, x, y, test_dtype):
9724 # Smoketest npymath functions
9725 z = test_dtype(complex(x, y))
9726 with np.errstate(invalid='ignore'):
9727 # Fallback implementations may emit a warning for +-inf (see gh-24876):
9728 # RuntimeWarning: invalid value encountered in absolute
9729 got = fun(z)
9730 expected = npfun(z)
9731 assert_allclose(got, expected)
9732
9733
9734def test_npymath_real():
9735 # Smoketest npymath functions
9736 from numpy.core._multiarray_tests import (
9737 npy_log10, npy_cosh, npy_sinh, npy_tan, npy_tanh)
9738
9739 funcs = {npy_log10: np.log10,
9740 npy_cosh: np.cosh,
9741 npy_sinh: np.sinh,
9742 npy_tan: np.tan,
9743 npy_tanh: np.tanh}
9744 vals = (1, np.inf, -np.inf, np.nan)
9745 types = (np.float32, np.float64, np.longdouble)
9746
9747 with np.errstate(all='ignore'):
9748 for fun, npfun in funcs.items():
9749 for x, t in itertools.product(vals, types):
9750 z = t(x)
9751 got = fun(z)
9752 expected = npfun(z)
9753 assert_allclose(got, expected)
9754
9755def test_uintalignment_and_alignment():
9756 # alignment code needs to satisfy these requirements:
9757 # 1. numpy structs match C struct layout
9758 # 2. ufuncs/casting is safe wrt to aligned access
9759 # 3. copy code is safe wrt to "uint alidned" access
9760 #
9761 # Complex types are the main problem, whose alignment may not be the same
9762 # as their "uint alignment".
9763 #
9764 # This test might only fail on certain platforms, where uint64 alignment is
9765 # not equal to complex64 alignment. The second 2 tests will only fail
9766 # for DEBUG=1.
9767
9768 d1 = np.dtype('u1,c8', align=True)
9769 d2 = np.dtype('u4,c8', align=True)
9770 d3 = np.dtype({'names': ['a', 'b'], 'formats': ['u1', d1]}, align=True)
9771
9772 assert_equal(np.zeros(1, dtype=d1)['f1'].flags['ALIGNED'], True)
9773 assert_equal(np.zeros(1, dtype=d2)['f1'].flags['ALIGNED'], True)
9774 assert_equal(np.zeros(1, dtype='u1,c8')['f1'].flags['ALIGNED'], False)
9775
9776 # check that C struct matches numpy struct size
9777 s = _multiarray_tests.get_struct_alignments()
9778 for d, (alignment, size) in zip([d1,d2,d3], s):
9779 assert_equal(d.alignment, alignment)
9780 assert_equal(d.itemsize, size)
9781
9782 # check that ufuncs don't complain in debug mode
9783 # (this is probably OK if the aligned flag is true above)
9784 src = np.zeros((2,2), dtype=d1)['f1'] # 4-byte aligned, often
9785 np.exp(src) # assert fails?
9786
9787 # check that copy code doesn't complain in debug mode
9788 dst = np.zeros((2,2), dtype='c8')
9789 dst[:,1] = src[:,1] # assert in lowlevel_strided_loops fails?
9790
9791class TestAlignment:
9792 # adapted from scipy._lib.tests.test__util.test__aligned_zeros
9793 # Checks that unusual memory alignments don't trip up numpy.
9794 # In particular, check RELAXED_STRIDES don't trip alignment assertions in
9795 # NDEBUG mode for size-0 arrays (gh-12503)
9796
9797 def check(self, shape, dtype, order, align):
9798 err_msg = repr((shape, dtype, order, align))
9799 x = _aligned_zeros(shape, dtype, order, align=align)
9800 if align is None:
9801 align = np.dtype(dtype).alignment
9802 assert_equal(x.__array_interface__['data'][0] % align, 0)
9803 if hasattr(shape, '__len__'):
9804 assert_equal(x.shape, shape, err_msg)
9805 else:
9806 assert_equal(x.shape, (shape,), err_msg)
9807 assert_equal(x.dtype, dtype)
9808 if order == "C":
9809 assert_(x.flags.c_contiguous, err_msg)
9810 elif order == "F":
9811 if x.size > 0:
9812 assert_(x.flags.f_contiguous, err_msg)
9813 elif order is None:
9814 assert_(x.flags.c_contiguous, err_msg)
9815 else:
9816 raise ValueError()
9817
9818 def test_various_alignments(self):
9819 for align in [1, 2, 3, 4, 8, 12, 16, 32, 64, None]:
9820 for n in [0, 1, 3, 11]:
9821 for order in ["C", "F", None]:
9822 for dtype in list(np.typecodes["All"]) + ['i4,i4,i4']:
9823 if dtype == 'O':
9824 # object dtype can't be misaligned
9825 continue
9826 for shape in [n, (1, 2, 3, n)]:
9827 self.check(shape, np.dtype(dtype), order, align)
9828
9829 def test_strided_loop_alignments(self):
9830 # particularly test that complex64 and float128 use right alignment
9831 # code-paths, since these are particularly problematic. It is useful to
9832 # turn on USE_DEBUG for this test, so lowlevel-loop asserts are run.
9833 for align in [1, 2, 4, 8, 12, 16, None]:
9834 xf64 = _aligned_zeros(3, np.float64)
9835
9836 xc64 = _aligned_zeros(3, np.complex64, align=align)
9837 xf128 = _aligned_zeros(3, np.longdouble, align=align)
9838
9839 # test casting, both to and from misaligned
9840 with suppress_warnings() as sup:
9841 sup.filter(np.ComplexWarning, "Casting complex values")
9842 xc64.astype('f8')
9843 xf64.astype(np.complex64)
9844 test = xc64 + xf64
9845
9846 xf128.astype('f8')
9847 xf64.astype(np.longdouble)
9848 test = xf128 + xf64
9849
9850 test = xf128 + xc64
9851
9852 # test copy, both to and from misaligned
9853 # contig copy
9854 xf64[:] = xf64.copy()
9855 xc64[:] = xc64.copy()
9856 xf128[:] = xf128.copy()
9857 # strided copy
9858 xf64[::2] = xf64[::2].copy()
9859 xc64[::2] = xc64[::2].copy()
9860 xf128[::2] = xf128[::2].copy()
9861
9862def test_getfield():
9863 a = np.arange(32, dtype='uint16')
9864 if sys.byteorder == 'little':
9865 i = 0
9866 j = 1
9867 else:
9868 i = 1
9869 j = 0
9870 b = a.getfield('int8', i)
9871 assert_equal(b, a)
9872 b = a.getfield('int8', j)
9873 assert_equal(b, 0)
9874 pytest.raises(ValueError, a.getfield, 'uint8', -1)
9875 pytest.raises(ValueError, a.getfield, 'uint8', 16)
9876 pytest.raises(ValueError, a.getfield, 'uint64', 0)
9877
9878
9879class TestViewDtype:
9880 """
9881 Verify that making a view of a non-contiguous array works as expected.
9882 """
9883 def test_smaller_dtype_multiple(self):
9884 # x is non-contiguous
9885 x = np.arange(10, dtype='<i4')[::2]
9886 with pytest.raises(ValueError,
9887 match='the last axis must be contiguous'):
9888 x.view('<i2')
9889 expected = [[0, 0], [2, 0], [4, 0], [6, 0], [8, 0]]
9890 assert_array_equal(x[:, np.newaxis].view('<i2'), expected)
9891
9892 def test_smaller_dtype_not_multiple(self):
9893 # x is non-contiguous
9894 x = np.arange(5, dtype='<i4')[::2]
9895
9896 with pytest.raises(ValueError,
9897 match='the last axis must be contiguous'):
9898 x.view('S3')
9899 with pytest.raises(ValueError,
9900 match='When changing to a smaller dtype'):
9901 x[:, np.newaxis].view('S3')
9902
9903 # Make sure the problem is because of the dtype size
9904 expected = [[b''], [b'\x02'], [b'\x04']]
9905 assert_array_equal(x[:, np.newaxis].view('S4'), expected)
9906
9907 def test_larger_dtype_multiple(self):
9908 # x is non-contiguous in the first dimension, contiguous in the last
9909 x = np.arange(20, dtype='<i2').reshape(10, 2)[::2, :]
9910 expected = np.array([[65536], [327684], [589832],
9911 [851980], [1114128]], dtype='<i4')
9912 assert_array_equal(x.view('<i4'), expected)
9913
9914 def test_larger_dtype_not_multiple(self):
9915 # x is non-contiguous in the first dimension, contiguous in the last
9916 x = np.arange(20, dtype='<i2').reshape(10, 2)[::2, :]
9917 with pytest.raises(ValueError,
9918 match='When changing to a larger dtype'):
9919 x.view('S3')
9920 # Make sure the problem is because of the dtype size
9921 expected = [[b'\x00\x00\x01'], [b'\x04\x00\x05'], [b'\x08\x00\t'],
9922 [b'\x0c\x00\r'], [b'\x10\x00\x11']]
9923 assert_array_equal(x.view('S4'), expected)
9924
9925 def test_f_contiguous(self):
9926 # x is F-contiguous
9927 x = np.arange(4 * 3, dtype='<i4').reshape(4, 3).T
9928 with pytest.raises(ValueError,
9929 match='the last axis must be contiguous'):
9930 x.view('<i2')
9931
9932 def test_non_c_contiguous(self):
9933 # x is contiguous in axis=-1, but not C-contiguous in other axes
9934 x = np.arange(2 * 3 * 4, dtype='i1').\
9935 reshape(2, 3, 4).transpose(1, 0, 2)
9936 expected = [[[256, 770], [3340, 3854]],
9937 [[1284, 1798], [4368, 4882]],
9938 [[2312, 2826], [5396, 5910]]]
9939 assert_array_equal(x.view('<i2'), expected)
9940
9941
9942@pytest.mark.xfail(_SUPPORTS_SVE, reason="gh-22982")
9943# Test various array sizes that hit different code paths in quicksort-avx512
9944@pytest.mark.parametrize("N", np.arange(1, 512))
9945@pytest.mark.parametrize("dtype", ['e', 'f', 'd'])
9946def test_sort_float(N, dtype):
9947 # Regular data with nan sprinkled
9948 np.random.seed(42)
9949 arr = -0.5 + np.random.sample(N).astype(dtype)
9950 arr[np.random.choice(arr.shape[0], 3)] = np.nan
9951 assert_equal(np.sort(arr, kind='quick'), np.sort(arr, kind='heap'))
9952
9953 # (2) with +INF
9954 infarr = np.inf*np.ones(N, dtype=dtype)
9955 infarr[np.random.choice(infarr.shape[0], 5)] = -1.0
9956 assert_equal(np.sort(infarr, kind='quick'), np.sort(infarr, kind='heap'))
9957
9958 # (3) with -INF
9959 neginfarr = -np.inf*np.ones(N, dtype=dtype)
9960 neginfarr[np.random.choice(neginfarr.shape[0], 5)] = 1.0
9961 assert_equal(np.sort(neginfarr, kind='quick'),
9962 np.sort(neginfarr, kind='heap'))
9963
9964 # (4) with +/-INF
9965 infarr = np.inf*np.ones(N, dtype=dtype)
9966 infarr[np.random.choice(infarr.shape[0], (int)(N/2))] = -np.inf
9967 assert_equal(np.sort(infarr, kind='quick'), np.sort(infarr, kind='heap'))
9968
9969def test_sort_float16():
9970 arr = np.arange(65536, dtype=np.int16)
9971 temp = np.frombuffer(arr.tobytes(), dtype=np.float16)
9972 data = np.copy(temp)
9973 np.random.shuffle(data)
9974 data_backup = data
9975 assert_equal(np.sort(data, kind='quick'),
9976 np.sort(data_backup, kind='heap'))
9977
9978
9979@pytest.mark.parametrize("N", np.arange(1, 512))
9980@pytest.mark.parametrize("dtype", ['h', 'H', 'i', 'I', 'l', 'L'])
9981def test_sort_int(N, dtype):
9982 # Random data with MAX and MIN sprinkled
9983 minv = np.iinfo(dtype).min
9984 maxv = np.iinfo(dtype).max
9985 arr = np.random.randint(low=minv, high=maxv-1, size=N, dtype=dtype)
9986 arr[np.random.choice(arr.shape[0], 10)] = minv
9987 arr[np.random.choice(arr.shape[0], 10)] = maxv
9988 assert_equal(np.sort(arr, kind='quick'), np.sort(arr, kind='heap'))
9989
9990
9991def test_sort_uint():
9992 # Random data with NPY_MAX_UINT32 sprinkled
9993 rng = np.random.default_rng(42)
9994 N = 2047
9995 maxv = np.iinfo(np.uint32).max
9996 arr = rng.integers(low=0, high=maxv, size=N).astype('uint32')
9997 arr[np.random.choice(arr.shape[0], 10)] = maxv
9998 assert_equal(np.sort(arr, kind='quick'), np.sort(arr, kind='heap'))
9999
10000def test_private_get_ndarray_c_version():
10001 assert isinstance(_get_ndarray_c_version(), int)
10002
10003
10004@pytest.mark.parametrize("N", np.arange(1, 512))
10005@pytest.mark.parametrize("dtype", [np.float32, np.float64])
10006def test_argsort_float(N, dtype):
10007 rnd = np.random.RandomState(116112)
10008 # (1) Regular data with a few nan: doesn't use vectorized sort
10009 arr = -0.5 + rnd.random(N).astype(dtype)
10010 arr[rnd.choice(arr.shape[0], 3)] = np.nan
10011 assert_arg_sorted(arr, np.argsort(arr, kind='quick'))
10012
10013 # (2) Random data with inf at the end of array
10014 # See: https://github.com/intel/x86-simd-sort/pull/39
10015 arr = -0.5 + rnd.rand(N).astype(dtype)
10016 arr[N-1] = np.inf
10017 assert_arg_sorted(arr, np.argsort(arr, kind='quick'))
10018
10019
10020@pytest.mark.parametrize("N", np.arange(2, 512))
10021@pytest.mark.parametrize("dtype", [np.int32, np.uint32, np.int64, np.uint64])
10022def test_argsort_int(N, dtype):
10023 rnd = np.random.RandomState(1100710816)
10024 # (1) random data with min and max values
10025 minv = np.iinfo(dtype).min
10026 maxv = np.iinfo(dtype).max
10027 arr = rnd.randint(low=minv, high=maxv, size=N, dtype=dtype)
10028 i, j = rnd.choice(N, 2, replace=False)
10029 arr[i] = minv
10030 arr[j] = maxv
10031 assert_arg_sorted(arr, np.argsort(arr, kind='quick'))
10032
10033 # (2) random data with max value at the end of array
10034 # See: https://github.com/intel/x86-simd-sort/pull/39
10035 arr = rnd.randint(low=minv, high=maxv, size=N, dtype=dtype)
10036 arr[N-1] = maxv
10037 assert_arg_sorted(arr, np.argsort(arr, kind='quick'))
10038
10039
10040@pytest.mark.skipif(not HAS_REFCOUNT, reason="Python lacks refcounts")
10041def test_gh_22683():
10042 b = 777.68760986
10043 a = np.array([b] * 10000, dtype=object)
10044 refc_start = sys.getrefcount(b)
10045 np.choose(np.zeros(10000, dtype=int), [a], out=a)
10046 np.choose(np.zeros(10000, dtype=int), [a], out=a)
10047 refc_end = sys.getrefcount(b)
10048 assert refc_end - refc_start < 10
10049
10050

10053 with pytest.raises(TypeError):
10054 np.choose(a, [3, -1])
